item.title: SJTU Ranks Second in 2014 Total Cites of International Publication in China
item.description:
On Oct 21st, Institute of Scientific and Technical Information of China (ISTIC) announced the statistical result of Chinese Scientific and Technical papers in Beijing. ISTIC put more emphasis on quality rather than quantity of SCI paper since 2010. SJTU won gratifying achievements in some important aspects in relation to the quality of papers: ranked the nation's second place in total cites of papers published internationally, as well as in Outstanding papers (total cites beyond average) and co-authored papers; ranked the nation's third place in quantity of papers published in journals with high impact factors.

In 2014, SJTU ranked second for the sixth consecutive year in number of papers collected by SCI: 5398 with a year-on-year growth of 497; ranked the nation's second place in SCI cites in past decade: 35488 with a year-on-year increase of 13794; held its nation's second place in quantity of SCI outstanding papers: 2402 with a year-on-year growth of 480; ranked the nation's second place in co-authored papers as first author: 1220 with a year-on-year increase of 162; held the nation's third place in quantity of papers published in journals with high impact factors in 154 disciplines with 181 papers; ranked the nation's fourth place in number of papers collected by SCI journal with top 10% impact factors: 762 with a year-on-year increase of 76; ranked the nation's fourth place in papers collected by Science, Nature, Cell and PNAS with total number 8. Paper entitled "Security and privacy for storage and computation in cloud computing" and "Activating hotspot L205R mutation in PRKACA and adrenal Cushing's syndrome", written by Associate Professor Zhu Jinhao from School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering and Ning Guang' research group from Rui Jin Hospital under School of Medicine respectively, were collected in "China's 100 Most Influential Academic Papers Publish Internationally in 2014".

The above data show that, with the vision on top-notch university, internal strength and academic atmosphere along with international cooperative school-running, SJTU witnessed its steady growth in both quality and quantity of scientific and technical papers, in a result further enhanced the university's international academic influence.

 

 

 

Translated by Wang Yifan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Won the First Prize of National Design Contest for Nine Successive Years
item.description:
From October 14 to 18, the Ninth National Students Design Competition was held in Yunnan Polytechnic University of Kunming. Student representative team from School of Ocean and Architectural Engineering, including Shen Jian and Ding Kai, majored in Civil Engineering, and Yan Yuanbu who majors in Architecture Yan Yuan. Under the guidance of associate professor of Department of Civil Engineering Song Xiaobing, and team leader Chen Sijia, these students achieved outstanding performance in the contest and won the SJTU's ninth first prize in National Students Structural Design Competition.

2015 marks the 70th anniversary of the victory of Anti-Japanese War. This year's competition features "Burma Road", an essential lifeline that was built with significant efforts in period of Chinese Anti-Japanese War. The project requires team members to use given bamboo skin material, and build a three-dimensional structure of the bridge on the mountain models that are based on the real shape the mountains. The competition also was introduced 3D printing material for the first time to be part of the production of a bridge. Whether it is from the theme, workload or innovation aspect, this year's competition deserves to be call the best ever.

It is understood that the National Design Contest was founded in 2005, one of the nine university students academic competitions as determined by the Ministry of Education. It is the highest level of competition of its kind aiming at nurturing civil engineering major Students' spirit of innovation, team spirit and practical ability. This year's competition has attracted participants from altogether 110 universities such as Tsinghua University, Zhejiang University, Tongji University, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Southwest Jiaotong University and Dalian University of Technology.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Shanghai—Ottawa United Medical College Held “White Coat Ceremony” Call to the Profession
item.description:
On the morning of October 17, the Shanghai—Ottawa United Medical College formed by Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine and the University of Ottawa held the white coat ceremony call to the profession for the first batch of students. President of the University of Ottawa Allan Rock, Canadian Consul Ryan Baerg, President Zhang Jie and department head of SJTU Affiliated Renji Hospital Li Weiping attended the ceremony.

 

President Zhang Jie expressed in the speech that SJTU has always been endeavoring to build the first class university in the world, and the United Medical College is the result of cooperation between the two countries’ higher education. He hoped that the two parts can deepen collaboration in the future. Allan Rock and Ryan Baerg also expressed their encouragements to the students.

 

Professor Cao Hui of the Renji Hospital explained the connotation of the oath of medical students, and the professional spirit of doctors. Later, fifty six new students put up their white coats and signed their names on the commitment.

 

The “White Coat Ceremony” originated from the medical schools of the Western world. On the ceremony, teachers and senior students give the white coat which signifies purity and kindness to new students, and help new students to understand the commitment of a doctor. 

 

The mentioned college is the first united medical college cooperated with North America and authorized by the country’s 985 program. This jointed effort will promote the development of Chinese revolution of the education in medicine school.

 

 

     

 

Translated by Xu Pan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU ANTAI EMBA Program Ranks Top 10 on 2015 "Financial Times" World's Top 100 List
item.description:
SJTU ANTAI EMBA Program and NTU EMBA Program tied for the first place among Asian Business Schools.

The British "Financial Times" (hereinafter referred to as FT) released the 2015 list of top 100 global EMBA program on October 19, 2015. Shanghai Jiaotong University Antai College of Economics and Management EMBA program and CEIBS EMBA program are on the list, respectively ranks 10th and 16th. This is the first time for Antai EMBA program to be listed in the global top10, and tied with Nanyang Technological University for the first place among Asian Business School EMBA programs.

SJTU Antai EMBA program being listed in the FT Top10 list is a great milestone of realizing the college strategic target of "becoming a national leading, Asia top-class, world-renowned business school". Currently Antai's master program of management, MBA program have both entered the FT Global 100, respectively ranks 36th and 55th. This May, the executive training program of Antai ranks 15th worldwide first in Asia on FT list.

Antai faculty's efforts in educating students as well as their strength in scientific research all provide a strong academic support for the development of Antai business school. In the latest QS World University Rankings, SJTU's 4 disciplines in economic management (Accounting and Finance, Business and Management, Economics and Econometrics, Statistics and Operations Research) are all in the top 100, and Statistics and Operations Research ranks 50th.

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Research Team Reveals Structural Origin of Glass Transition
item.description:
Recently, a team led by Wang Yujie from Department of Physics and Astronomy of STJU published a thesis titled "Structural origin of hard-sphere glass transition in granular packing system" on Nature Communications. Via probing into the model system of hard-sphere glass (the granular packing system), they brought it to light that glass transition was probably a type of special structure phase transition.

In the process of rapid cooling, liquid will not turn into subcooled liquid via crystallization, instead, with the rapid increase of the coefficient of viscosity by a dozen orders of magnitude, the glass transition occurs, and liquid becomes glass state. The issue of glass transition is one of the most important issues in the field of Condensed Matter Physics. As P.W. Anderson, Noble Prize winner and Professor of Princeton University, put it in 1995, "The deepest and most interesting unsolved problem in solid state theory is probably the theory of the nature of glass and glass transition". Furthermore, the issue was listed by Science Magazine as one of the 125 major unsolved problems in science in 2005.

At present, there exist so many theories on the issue of glass transition that no unanimous solution has been found. The research result of Wang Yujie's team indicates that glass transition may be a common structural phase transition analogous to the course of crystallization, which provides key experimental evidence for finally tackling the problem of glass transition which has remained unsolved for around fifty years.

 

 

 

 

Translated by：Zhao Bingquan       Reviewed by: Wang Bingyu

item.title: Two Teams from Shanghai Jiao Tong University Won Gold in iGEM
item.description:
After 6 days heated competition, 2015 World Finals of iGEM(International Genetically Engineered Machine Competition) came to its end recently in Hynes Convention Center. Two teams from Shanghai Jiao Tong University, named SJTU-BioX-Shanghai and SJTU-Software won the gold medal.

Led by Academician He Lin and Associate Professor Ma Gang, SJTU-Biox-Shanghai consisted of 14 undergraduates from SJTU School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology and Zhiyuan College. The team's project "Cyano Pac-man" was to build biodesalination system in cyanobacteria. Common seawater desalination technology, such as reverse osmosis could not be scaled up to wide use due to high energy consumption. To develop biodesalination was to build an efficient and energy-saving desalination system. The team used photosynthetic cyanophyta as desalination chassis cell and light-driven CI pump halorhodopsin as desalination driver, dark-induced promoter as desalination controller, successfully built an energy-efficient biodesalination system depending only on natural light and dark conditions. This biodesalination system successfully lowered the concentration of Na and CI by 20% in lab environment. The team kept practicing and exploring feasible cyanophyta-water separation process. The team put forward with the idea that biodesalination can be used as pretreatment of reverse osmosis.

Supervised by Chaochun Wei, Hongyu Ou and Feng Chen, SJTU-Software was a team of 14 undergraduates from School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, School of Biochemical Engineering and School of Media and Design. The team's project "BASE" was developed from last year's project "Easy BBK-An Easy Biobrick Blueprint's Package". "BASE" integrated main functions of "Easy BBK" and implemented it by web application. The team built a new BioBrick database and added more information about BioBrick to official database. This was to better measure reliability level in experiment and sort search results by user need or BioBrick mass. The BioBrick drawing tool designed by the team made it possible for standardization of future BioBrick and the design of smart guided BioBrick. Moreover, the uploading tool developed by the team could connect information of each sub BioBrick with database, thus making uploading information more efficient. The innovative design aroused interest of judges and received excellent review in poster presentation and oral defense.

iGEM was first launched by MIT in 2004, designed for college students and gradually developed to be the top academic competition in Synthetic Biology. Supervised by specialized committee, the competition was also an interdisciplinary contest that involved mathematics, physics, electronics and computer science. iGEM requires contestants to select topic independently and trains their independent innovation, teamwork spirit and enthusiasm in science. The competition is also an international exchange platform for students majoring in diversified fields from the world over. iGEM 2015 attracted 270 teams from the globe, including teams from top universities such as MIT, Harvard, Cambridge and Heidelburg University. China sent 61 teams to the competition.

Each year several projects in iGEM were published in Science and Nature. In addition, iGEM expects excellent comprehensive capabilities and skills from contestants, it also covers various non-experiment tasks, for example, designing poster for project introduction, launching awareness campaigns to popularize Synthetic Biology.

 

 

Translated by Wang Yifan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: High-yielding of Pseudomonas Source Green Pesticide Progressed Significantly
item.description:
Recently, the international authoritative journal Metabolic Engineering released "Engineering the central biosynthetic and secondary metabolic pathways of Pseudomonas aeruginosa strain PA1201 to improve PCA production"（http://authors.elsevier.com/a/1RmH5_OxxoOjVB）, the research findings of He Yawen research group from School of Life Sciences and Biotechnologies and State Key Laboratory of Microbial Metabolism, Shanghai Jiao Tong University. The first author is the doctoral candidate Jin Kaiming and Zhou Lian, associate research fellow.

Natural pesticide metabolites is an important development direction. Phenazino-1-carboxylic acid is a new bio-pesticide worked out by Xu Yuquan group together with Shanghai Pungmul. It got the the pesticide registration certificate in 2011 and its main ingredients could defend the crops from a series of crop diseases efficiently and environmental-friendly.

To lower down the cost, He Yawen group segregates a new biocontrol pseudomonas PA1201 to produce phenazine carboxylic acid pca and Phenazine - 1 - amide at the same time（Acta Microbiologica Sinica, 2015,55:401-11）. Based on this, with the help of promoter replacement stategry, the metabolic flux got effective transmission, Phenazine synthetic gene cluster got high-efficiency expression and the tripartite efflux system of phenazine carboxylic acid pca got optimized; markerless deletion made the fermentation potency of Phenazino-1-carboxylic acid improved 53.6 times to 9 gpl, which would significantly decrease the production cost.

Zhang Xuehong group from School of Life Sciences and Biotechnologies also made progress in high-yielding research of 2-OH-PHZ etc. Now they are applying for patent for invention. Liu Jianhua group made progress in Phenazine metabolites' systhesis regulation. Related researched were assisted by Ministry of Science and Technology 863 Project （No. 2012AA022107), Five-year science and technology support plan （No. 2012BAD19B01）, Project 973 （No. 2012CB721000）and Shanghai municipal education commission key projects of scientific research and innovation （No. GM0800004）.

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Rice University President David Leebron Visited SJTU
item.description:
On the afternoon of September, 28, 2015, Rice University President David Leebron, with his delegation, visited Shanghai Jiao Tong University. SJTU President Zhang Jie introduced the recent developments of SJTU, especially in the aspect of talent introduction. He hoped that the cooperation between Business Schools of these two universities can be implemented, moreover, the education and academic exchanges can be extended to other professional fields. President Leebron agreed with it, and he hoped that these two universities could explore proper fields for students and teachers to communicate and exchange with each other so that these two famous universities in China and America can cooperate in real fields. Some officials from Antai College of Economics & Management and Division of International Cooperation and Exchange also joined in this meeting.

After the meeting, President Leebron with his delegation exchanged experiences in education with University of Michigan-Shanghai Jiao Tong University Joint Institute.

Rice University, located in the Houston of Texas, is praised as one of Harvard in southern regions and it keeps a leading place in material science, nanoscience, artificial heart researches and space science all over the world. Jesse H. Jones Grade School of Business, George R. Brown School of Engineering, School of Architecture, and School of Music enjoyed a high reputation. Its education quality and research level rank highest among American universities. Rice University implements residential college system like Oxford University, In the university, about 40% undergraduates choose two majors and there are 3888 undergraduates and 2610 graduates.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU MSFW System Won Silver Medal in Global Grand Challenge Summit
item.description:
Jointly organized by Chinese Academy of Engineering, National Academy of Engineering and the Royal Academy of Engineering, the Second Global Grand Challenges Summit finished its competition day for students on Sept 10th in Beijing, China. 15 competing teams are from China, America and Britain. SJTU team won the second prize for its "MSFW-based Distributed Power Generation, Power Processing and Storage System".

Jiajun Cao, a student from School of Mechanical Engineering, spend 6 years together with his team in this project. He started scientific innovation during secondary school studies. As a student of SJTU Affiliated Secondary School pilot class, he participated in the 26th China Adolescents Science & Technology Innovation Contest and won the first prize. Per his discussion and communication with professors and other contestants, he was attracted by MSFW battery. The battery is able to transform electric energy into kinetic energy. High sensitive to technology, Jiajun began to apply motor to MSFW.

One year later, Jiajun entered SJTU School of Mechanical Engineering pilot class. With advanced innovation platform and equipments provided by the School, Jiajun decided to deepen his research on MSFW motor. After numerous repeated experiment, his NO.2 motor realized the expected functions and won first prize at the Sixth National University Student Social Practice and Science Contest on Energy Saving & Emission Reduction.

Jiajun's team stood out from other teams in selective trials of Global Grand Challenges Summit in June of 2015. Jiajun, Jingcheng Ma and Qian Yang from School of Mechanical Engineering; Yu Shang, Yuan Fu from School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering; Xiao Zhang from School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering joined hands and finished NO.4 sample motor during summer vacation. They successfully notched silver after the motor's onsite presentation.

When asked about his vision about MSFW flywheel, Jiajun said that he hoped to build an engineering sample and keep improving upon specific demands, and eventually realize it engineering applications.

 

 

Translated by Wang Yifan         Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU President Zhang Jie Won Edward Teller Award
item.description:
SJTU President Zhang Jie is an academician of Chinese Academy of Sciences, physical scientist in the field of laser plasma, and the President of Shanghai Jiao Tong University. He and his team have made great contributions in the study of quick fire laser fusion and the study of astrophysics in the intense laser laboratory. On the 24th of September 2015, Zhang won the 2015 Edward Teller Award of the American Nuclear Society. This is the first time that Chinese scientist won the highest prize in this field, which add to the honors to the relative researches in our country.

Zhang Jie is awarded the Edward Teller Medal in recognition of his significant contributions to the study of generation and propagation of hot electrons in laser-plasmas relevant to ICF and reproduction of astrophysical processes.

Zhang Jie, President of Shanghai Jiao Tong University, has made major contributions to understanding laser-plasma interactions including fast electron generation and propagation by high intensity short pulse lasers. Jie received his PhD from the Institute of Physics, Chinese Academy of Science in 1988. He joined the Max-Planck Institute for Quantum Optics in Germany as a Humboldt fellow for research in x-ray lasers and laser plasma interactions. He continued his research in these areas at Rutherford Appleton Laboratory and the University of Oxford from 1990 to 1998. He returned to China to establish a new research laboratory at the Institute of Physics, Chinese Academy of Science successfully building a series of short pulse lasers for laser-plasma research. His work on short pulse laser-plasma interactions has led to an understanding of the role of laser prepulse and self-focusing on fast electron generation. He and collaborators have used high-powered lasers to successfully create conditions resembling the vicinity of black holes and model the loop-top x-ray source and reconnection overflow in solar flares. Dr. Zhang has published over 200 papers in international scientific journals. He has received numerous awards and achievements including Foreign Associate of the National Academy of Science and Foreign Member of the Royal Academy of Engineering.

Edward Teller Award was established by the American Nuclear Society, and was named after the "Father of Hydrogen Bomb" Edward Teller. It is the highest prize in the field of nuclear fusion, and is to issue every two year on the International Conference on Inertial Fusion Science Applications (IFSA). Every time there will be two winners, and they must have significant achievements and leadership in the study of generation and propagation of hot electrons in laser-plasmas and controllable thermal energy fusion.

See also:http://www.ifsa15.org/edward-teller-medal.php

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Students Win 3 Awards in Shanghai College Students Video Contest
item.description:
Recently, Shanghai Municipal Science and Technology Commission held the awards ceremony of its first "College Student Innovative Science Video Contest" in Shanghai Twenty-first Century Minsheng Art Museum. The students from Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Media and Design won three big awards out of five.

Three sophomore students majored in Journalism, Guan Yuanci, Jin Hanzhi and Liu Yuhao, and their work "Vigor" won the Best Script Award; three first year graduate students of Journalism and Communication, Yu zhou, He Jia, Qiao Yanu and Wu Cunwen, and their work "Drones Against Haze" won Best Cinematography Award; the work of Yu Zhou, Wu Cunwen, Tang Jiayu and Wang YuBin "Liu Su" won the Best Film Award. Besides, Shu Yang and Wang Jinglin, and their work "Smart Life" also won an excellent award. All the above mentioned teams are guided by Associate Professor Wang Hao from Department of Journalism and Communication.

Professor Wang Hao said that the three awards won by SJTU students are the most valuable awards in this competition. The result of this competition has fully shown the impressive competence of the SJTU students in the terms of video production and innovation.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: ACEM Welcomes 2015 New MIB Students
item.description:
Antai College of Economics & Management (ACEM) welcomed its 2015 enrolled graduate students at SJTU Xuhui Campus on September 12th.

More than 70 MIB students from all over the world attended  ACEM's Opening Ceremony of this academic year. They were welcomed by Dean Zhou Lin and the executive team of the college, professors, alumni students and current students. On behalf of 2015 MIB students, Laura Van Laer from Belgium spoke about the reasons she applied for Antai and her expectation for this program. She said "Antai College of Economics & Management is one of the best schools in the world. I like ACEM's MIB program, because this master program focuses on both western and Chinese business aspects and it is quite unique differing from other programs. So far I really like that our class is so diverse. There are classmates from all kinds of different regions of the world and it is a perfect mix of different cultures. Confucius once said 'when I walk with others, one of them can become my teacher'. I hope in the coming two years I can not only learn about doing business, but also learn a lot about different cultures from my classmates." 

The MIB program orientation was held on the same day right after the Opening Ceremony, presented by Dean Zhou Lin, Associate Dean Wan Guohua, Associate Dean Tang Ningyu, MIB Program Director Lu Lin, the board of MIB professors, program coordinating team. Dean Zhou made a welcome speech in a vivid way, Associate Dean Wan encouraged new students to make full use their time in Antai and its resources, while Associate Dean Tang talked about the targets and the key features of the program. In the past two years, MIB students have got internship opportunities, at KPMG, PHILIPS, SAP etc. and some of them found jobs in well-known MNCs both at home and abroad.  ACEM is committed to make itself a bridge between China and other countries and a college to develop global talents. 

On Sunday the new MIB cohort headed to Minhang Campus for their first team building. MIB Program Director Lu Lin designed a "Kick-off Expedition". During the Expedition, all the students were divided into 10 groups, each group had to fulfill tasks around the campus within three hours. At the end of the team building, all participants shared their feelings and learnings and concluded that team spirit and cooperation made them closer and stronger. In this way, the new students got to know each other better and quicker.

 

 

Source: Antai College of Economics & Management

item.title: SJTU Listed Top 70 in 2015 QS World University Rankings
item.description:
September 15, 2015 marks the release of the newest edition of the QS World University Rankings, Shanghai Jiao Tong University was listed Top 70 in QS World University Rankings with 7 subjects ranking World Top 50 and 18 subjects ranking World Top 100. In order to better reflect the characteristics of various subjects, the QS ranking indicators this year were balanced for weight adjustment. After extensive consultation with expert opinion, QS did standardization process to the indicator "Citations per faculty" and each five fields of subjects takes up 20 percent in comprehensive performance. The improvement of Shanghai Jiaotong University further reflects the coordination of different subjects with "comprehensive, research-based and international" school policy.

The primary aim of the QS World University Rankings is to help students make informed comparisons of leading universities around the world. Based on six performance indicators, the rankings are designed to assess universities in four areas: research, teaching, employability and internationalization. Each of the six performance indicators carries a different weighting when calculating the overall scores with academic reputation (40%), employer reputation (10%), student-to-faculty ratio (20%), citations per faculty (20%), international faculty ratio (5%) and international student ratio (5%). For the 2015/16 edition, the rankings for Academic reputation draw on just under 76,800 responses from academics worldwide. The employer reputation indicator is also based on a global survey, taking in more than 44,200 responses for the 2015/16 edition.

SJTU had improved gradually in QS World University Rankings and this year marks the first time that SJTU was listed as World Top 100, moving up by 34 positions to the 70th. In the 2015 QS World University rankings, SJTU ranked third in the country with seven subjects of Shanghai Jiaotong University ranking among the world's top 50 and 18 subjects ranking the world's top 100 with 25 subjects entering the 200. The top 50 subjects are art and design, civil and structural engineering, machinery, aerospace and manufacturing engineering, materials science, electrical and electronic engineering, construction, and statistics. The series of all kinds of progress in QS World University Rankings of Shanghai Jiaotong University fully reflects improvement of academic ability and academic reputation in recent years which consolidate the foundation for SJTU's completion of a comprehensive world-class university in near future.

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Convocation for Grade 2015 Was Grandly Held
item.description:
In the morning of September 13th, the convocation for grade 2015 students of Shanghai Jiao Tong University(SJTU) was grandly held in the new gymnasium on Minhang campus. More than ten thousand new students and school leadership Jiang Sixian, Zhang Jie, Guo Xinli, Lin Zhongqin, Wu Dan, Huang Zhen, Zhu Jian, Mei Hong, Xu Xuemin, Gu Feng, together with teaching representatives and parents were present.

President of SJTU Zhang Jie welcomed more than 12000 new students coming from 115 countries and said “independence makes a better person”. He stressed that independence was the inevitable path to the future and it would help to cultivate a better person.

Zhang Jie encouraged all the students with three key words, namely “confidence”, “self-motivation” and “introspection”. He shared some students’ experience to motivate all new students, wishing them to think about the new meaning of independence from self-identification, self-motivation and self-inspection. President Zhang Jie stressed that confidence is the kindling to light the dream, self-motivation is the inertia to keep pursuing your dream while self-inspection is to go beyond yourself after the inspection.

Dai Kerong, teacher representative, academicians of Chinese Academy of Engineering and the lifetime professor of Shanghai Ninth People’s Hospital, SJTU School of Medicine, compared going to university to a “favorable turnaround in one’s life” and told the students how to master it. He suggested students to have a good understanding of SJTU who had been established for more than a century from the history, campus, classrooms, libraries, students, roommates, teachers and so on.

Zhang Guowei, undergraduate student representative of grade 2013 in Antai College of Economics and Management, won the silver medal in men’s high jump competition in 2015 Beijing World Anthletics Championships and created the new history for Chinese in this field. He encouraged new students to overcome all difficulties to make better even if there would be difficulties. He wished all students could make our own contributions to the 120th birthday of SJTU.

Qin Jiani, new student from School of Media and Design, spoke for new students. She reviewed her experience in attending the college entrance examination and the time when she was enrolled in SJTU. She said that she would try her best to learn, to experience, to challenge and to dig her interests in SJTU.

 “We would keep the school motto in mind and fight for the future of the human kind.” At the end of the ceremony, all students made their vows and sang the anthem.

On the convocation, students displayed the original video “Parents”from which new students experienced the family affection once again.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: American Super Scholars Choose SJTU
item.description:
The Biomedical Engineering Double Master Program taught in full-English is a new program launched by the School of Biomedical Engineering of Shanghai Jiao Tong University last year, which has already attracted applicants in great numbers. This year, the program enrolled 12 students from six countries. Among them are super scholarship winner from world-class institutes of technology, student of academician of the Russian National Academy of Sciences, and also the US President's Management Award winner who is willing to give up a government administration position to join this program. These applicants all think studying in SJTU attract them more.

Marcus R. Hosler, an undergraduate student majored in biological engineering at Purdue University, has obtained eight scholarships in four-year undergraduate study. Marcus also minored in philosophy, Marcus is also the second author of a paper published in an authoritative journal in Biochemistry (The Journal of Biological Chemistry). Marcus came to know SJTU from his college mentor who had once visited the School of Biomedical Engineering of SJTU and was left a deep impression. After this exchange visit, the professor strongly recommended Marcus to SJTU when knowing that Marcus intends to pursue a graduate degree.

In 2007, Christopher Ivan Ivanovich graduated from the Chemistry Department of University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC, rank 29 in TIMES global ranking in 2004), and entered the University of Chicago to pursue a master's degree in social sciences. He is the President of Management Award finalist whose excellent management and leadership skills have been fully endorsed by the US government. By virtue of this experience, he can get a chance to work in the federal government, but he gave this chance to study in SJTU. Before coming to SJTU, Christopher served in the National Great Rivers Research & Education Center as an environment researcher and worked as an editor of American Journal Experts Edit. Besides he also worked as a researcher at UIUC genomics laboratory and a Global academic fellow at New York University.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan     Reviewed by Wang Binyu

item.title: Zhang Dabing Recognized by APSB as One of Most Highly Cited Asian Scientists
item.description:
Recently, Professor Zhang Dabing of SJTU was included in a name list announced byAmerican Society of Plant Biologists (APSB), which recognized the authors of the most highly cited papers published between 2009 and 2013. Altogether nine Asian scientists were acknowledged in the list and Professor Zhang was the only scientist from mainland China.

APSB was founded in 1924 and has been committed to boosting the advancement and development of plant biology, fostering research as well as publishing the latest results in the area, enhancing plant biologists' research interests and helping them score achievements in their research areas. The APSB publishes two journals, including Plant Cell (founded in 1989 and having an average impact factor of 10.529 in the past five years) and Plant Physiology (found in 1926 and having an average impact factor of 8.03 in the past five years), which are both respected as the authoritative journals on botany.

APSB first introduced the authors of the most highly cited papers in 2009, mainly covering scientists from North America and Europe. This year, APSB analyzed the global citations to Plant Cell and Plant Physiology for papers published between 2009 and 2013, and listed the authors from Asia, Australia, North America, Middle East and Africa. Professor Zhang has conducted systematic research into reproduction and development with respect to rice and other plants, revealing multiple molecular mechanisms that control the formation of rice inflorescence, rice flower organs, and rice pollen. Between 2009 and 2013, Professor Zhang published 8 papers in Plant Cell and 9 in Plant Physiology, which are all highly cited. As a result, he was include in the list as the only scientist from mainland China. 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan  Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Zhang Guowei Won Silver Medal in World Championship
item.description:
August 30th was the last day of the World Championship. In the high jump men final, Zhang Guowei, undergraduate student in grade 2013, majoring in Human Resources Management in Antai College of Economics and Management of Shanghai Jiao Tong University（SJTU），shared the silver medal with Ukrainian Bondarnko with 2.33 meters height during the overtime so that he surpassed Zhu Jianhua's bronze medal record in 1983 Helsinki World Championship and made the best record for Chinese Track and Filed Team in World Championship in the field of high jump, which was also the same as the best record for Asian athlete in this field in the World Championship.

In the preliminary contest, Zhang Guowei made the 2.31 meters easily and entered the final. The starting height of the final is 2.20 meters. Zhang Guowei made it 2.20, 2.25, 2.29 and 2.33. At then, there were only 5 athletes left.

Because of the weather, no one made it when it reached 2.36 meters. Three athletes including Zhang Guowei had the same grade. According to the rules of the championship, they three entered the overtime contest. For no one could successfully surpass the 2.36 meters. They made it 2.34 in the overtime. Drouin was the first to make it, but Bondarnko and Zhang Guowei both failed. Thus they two shared the second position and Zhang Guowei created the new history for Chinese high jump business.

Zhang Guowei had good marks in this season. He made it 2.38, 2.36, 2.35 etc. Currently, he was only second to Qataris Barshim.

 

Translated by Ling Jie   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Professor Leo KoGuan Attended China Institute of Legal History 2015 Annual Academic Conference
item.description:
On August 14th-17th, 2015, the China Institute of Legal History 2015 Annual Academic Conference & the International Symposium on "Traditional Legal Culture and Modern Rule of Law Culture" was held in Shenyang. Professor Leo KoGuan, Honorary Trustee of Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Honorary Professor of KoGuan Law School, and Director of KoGuan International Rule of Law and Principle Studies Center, was invited to participate in the conference and give the keynote speech on "Xuan Yuan Calling: A Draft for Chinese Consensus 4712XY". The conference was hosted by China Institute of Legal History, organized by Shenyang Normal University School of Law and co-organized by KoGuan Chinese Rule of Law and Principle Studies Center, Tsinghua University School of Law.

Prof. Leo passionately made a wonderful speech for all participants. He incorporated equations and numbers into the 00 poem (KQID engine) that precisely computed the creation and distribution of our Universe and Existence and composed Xuan Yuan Calling poem (Xuan Yuan Anti-entropic Operating System 2.0).The two poems expressed his theory in a nutshell in one bookmark. He was the first person rejuvenated Xuan Yuan 2.0 powered by the Chinese Engine with scientific equations that produce detailed numbers to explain and predict things that cannot be explained and predicted by the existing Newtonian engine, Einstein Relativity, the Grand Unified Theory (GUT) and the Standard Model Cosmology. The KQID engine computes in a specific and detailed way with equations and numbers which is verifiable and falsifiable. He succinctly iterated that the Xuan Yuan 2.0 is the rule of Dao, which is the best of all possible rules that unifies Humanity with Science based on Seeking Truth from Facts and the unity of names and forms.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Earlier he also gave a speech at the "1st Summit of Chinese Judicial Studies Association" headed by Chief Justice Zhou Qiang, the think tank where Prof. Leo serves as a council member. He Zhonglin, Deputy Director of the Research Office of the Supreme Court, highlighted his speech:

Chinese culture derives from Xuan Yuan Dao, which is the ontology of the "Chineseness" of being Chinese. It does not depend on people's DNA, but their cultural identity. In China, everything is based on Rule of Dao, Rule of the Party, Rule of the People, Rule of Law and Rule of Virtues. Xuan Yuan's jurisprudence relies openly upon rule of Dao that sets the boundary and the guiding principle for Chinese rule of law. (People·Rule of Law)

After his keynote speech, Prof. Leo and President Wu Yuzhang presided over the seminar to elaborate on the ontology of the "Chineseness" of being Chinese. After full and heated discussion, the participating scholars fully recognized Prof. Leo's scholarly works and achieved preliminary consensus that from rule of Dao come rule of law and rule of virtues as the authentic Chinese jurisprudence.

 

Souce: KoGuan Law School

item.title: [People.cn]Jiang Xiaoyuan Science Fiction Movie Guide Appear on 2015 Shanghai Bookfair
item.description:
Ordinary audiences are quite familiar with science fiction movies, like The Matrix, Interstellar and so on. But it is not easy to name a decent Chinese science fiction movie. So people are wondering: why China cannot make a science fiction blockbuster? Where are China's science fiction movies?

Recently, Jiang Xiaoyuan Science Fiction Movie Guide written by Pro. Jiang Xiaoyuan, expert in history of science, is released by Shanghai Jiao Tong University Press and holds a news conference in 2015 Shanghai Bookfair. This guide book is considered as the first in-depth interpretation for science fiction of a scholar in China.

It is said that Jiang Xiaoyuan initiated his study in science fiction movies in 2003 when SARS was plaguing China. After a dozen years, this recreational mode is changed into academic research. He has published lots of film review on science fiction movies. This book is a by-product of above mentioned academic researches.

The book is divided into ten chapters, involving more than 180 science fictions. There are classic movies, like The Matrix, movies of small audiences, like Double Vision. The shooting of Chinese science fiction movie, Three Body, is sure to bring more and more discussion regarding this field. As to the "First Year of Chinese Science Fiction", Mr. Jiang believes that it could open starts with a successful native Chinese blockbuster.

Liu Cixin, science fiction writer, attended the conference and said that this book established a brand new comment context and perspective, from which it pointed to the core heart of the science fiction movie. "There is no lack of money or technology for Chinese science fiction. What we are lack of is our imagination and feelings. In other words, We are lack of recognition for science fiction."

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: In Memory of Zhang Disheng： All My Career
item.description:
Editor's Notes:

Zhang Disheng, Academician of Chinese Academy of Sciences, died on August 19 in Shanghai. He was 100 years old.

Zhang Disheng was an outstanding member of the Communist Party of China, member of fifth, sixth, seventh Shanghai Committee of Chinese People Consultative Conference National Committee, the founder of plastic surgery and reconstructive surgery, excellent physician, educator, scientist, academician of Chinese Academy of Engineering, Shanghai role model, professor of Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine, and former president of Affiliated Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University.

The following article was especially written for SJTU column "Scholars' essay" by Zhang Disheng in 2011.

Taking a Correct Attitude

Back in history, the occupation of doctor is adored by Chinese for various reasons. Some would like to be a good person so they become doctors and some just practice medicine for money.

I suggest that young people first ask yourself a few "Why", before choosing medicine. If you only want to feed your families, you need not study medicine. Especially in the current domestic medical environment, becoming a doctor requires more inputs and limited outputs. If you make a change in career and spend the same energy in other field, it would be absolutely not difficult to earn bigger achievements. A few years ago, I heard that there are young doctors leaving the medical industry because of low income and high pressure. I can fully understand their practices, but I can not help but regret for them. Life can not afford to toss. Instead of drop halfway after the switch, I recommend you to think clearly before choosing where to go.

 

The Pursuit of Excellence

The pursuit of excellence does not mean that we should disregard the actual situation and establish unattainable goals. As Lincoln put it, "I would use the best of my knowledge, the best I can to do the best, and I have been determined to do so." As a plastic surgeon, I comprehend it too well. Many cosmetic surgery, seem so simple and a lot of doctors will say they can do, but the effect may be different. Generally an excellent plastic surgeon has a "perfectionist" mentality, and always pays more attention to details than others. Adhering to this habit, you will continue to find more ways and techniques and make the ordinary things better. That is a remarkable.

 

Being Bold but Cautious

I am disturbed that, in recent years, due to the deterioration of the health care environment, when faced with difficult cases, many doctors become fearful. Many doctors worry that the doctor-patient relationship are tired. I'm looking forward to the establishment of strict safeguards against both doctors and patients. Perhaps by that time, the patient will be calmer, the doctor will regain courage.

 

Accumulation

Plastic surgery I am engaged in is an interdisciplinary subject established on the basis of discipline and my personal achievements and are mainly concerned with interdisciplinary. For example, if I do not communicate with colleagues in other disciplines, I will miss the "Microsurgery" trend; If I do not pay attention to Chinese medicine, I can not think of the treatment of chronic lymphedema of "bake tied therapy" and homemade cream treatment of burn scar patients. It should be noted that, all these achievements are made in my sixties, seventies, which of course has something to do with a special historical context, but also my knowledge, experience accumulated to a certain extent, has finally paid off.

 

Contemplation

Finally, I would like to give message to the younger generation. If in the future you have the opportunity to climb the peak on medicine, while enjoying the scenery at the same time at the top, please be sure to find time to bow to look at the bottom and seriously think about their living conditions and expectations. Because they have passion, but it is more helpless. This may be unrelated to responsibility, but in respect of the mission.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Achieves Major Breakthrough in Two-Dimensional Crystal New Material Stanene
item.description:
Editor's note:

For more than one century, SJTUers have got innumerable great achievements with their knowledge and wisdom, including many firsts in modern and contemporary Chinese history. This reflects wisdom of talent training, scientific research, serving the society and glory for the country. In memory of SJTUer's great contribution to China's prosperity, SJTU News sets up a new column named "SJTU Wisdom" to tell their story.

 

In August 3, 2015, the international academic journal Nature Materials published a theoretical paper (http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nmat4384) on new stanene written by Prof. Qian Dong and Jia Jinfeng's research group together with their academic partners. Both of Prof. Qian and Jia are from Department of Physics and Astronomy in SJTU. After a long-time in-depth experiment and exploration, their team found a suitable substrate material and growth conditions, and first prepared stanene, the two-dimensional crystal thin-film material with MBE (molecular beam epitaxy) in the world.

In the same day, Nature reported this research finding with the headline "Physicists announce graphene's latest cousin: stanene" and highlighted the amazing physical properties of this new material. Scholars from home and aboard affirmed this big breakthrough in two-dimensional crystal material and commented that this is the first and a key step to realize its amazing properties and functions in the future (doi:10.1038/nature.2015.18113). Chemistryworld, official website of RSC (the Royal Society of Chemistry) reported this finding in details with the headline "New two-diensional tin material created" on August 5. Science alert also did a report on it with the title "Physicists produce world's first sample of potential wonder-material: stanene".

As graphene achieves great success, IV group elements two-dimensional crystal material comes into focus of Condensed Matter Physics and Materials Science. Although stanene is a theoretically ideal and novel quantum material, it is still a long way to go for researchers in Condensed Matter Physics and Materials Science to produce stanene material in experiment, in the condition of difficulties in material preparation and physics knowledge.

Surface Topography of Stanene Thin-Film

Atomic Model Diagram of Stanene Thin-Film

Electronic Band Structure of Stanene Thin-Film    

 

Prof. Jia Jinfeng and his team from Department of Physics and Astronomy of SJTU has long committed to preparation and research of new quantum material. They are the first to prepare Topological Insulator (or superconductor heterojunction), thus accumulated deep experience in thin-film epitaxial growth. After incessant exploration and practice, they finally found that with a precise growing condition, the growth pattern of Sn atom changed and formed a thin layer. In this way, the dream stanene is successfully prepared.

The research group overcame two difficulties to prove that this thin-film was stanene. They found that the atomic structure and electronic band structure delivered from the experiment were in good consistency with the result of first-principle calculation, consequently confirmed that the epitaxial growth was two-dimensional stanene thin-film. This theoretical paper attracted tremendous attention in the international academia.

This research project was funded by Ministry of Science and Technology and NSFC (Nature Science Foundation of China). It took two years for Prof. Jia Jinfeng's research group from SJTU and Prof. Zhang Shousheng's theoretical group from Tsinghua University and Stanford University to complete it.

 

 

Translated by Wang Yifan  Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Made Achievements on Research of Lyso-glycosphingolipid Production
item.description:
Recently, "A facile method for controlling the reaction equilibrium of sphingolipid ceramide N-deacylase for lyso-glycosphingolipid production" was published online in the Journal of Lipid Research. It is the recent research progress on enzymatic method for the production of glycosphingolipids compound made by the research group from School of Life Science and Biotechnology, SJTU and state key laboratory of microbial metabolism. The first author of the research is Huang Fengtao, a doctor from SJTU, and Yang Guangyu, an associate researcher, is his academic advisor.

Glycosphingolipid is an amphipathic glycolipids compound made up by ceramide and oligosaccharide chain through glucosidic bonds and widely participates in the biochemical signaling between cells and surroundings. It plays an important role in each stage of cells, such as proliferation, differentiation, senescence and apoptosis. Glycosphingolipids compound has certain efficacy against some serious disease, such as cancer, neurodegenerative disease, and autoimmune disease etc.. However, as the chemosynthetic methods of lyso-glycosphingolipid is constrained by its complicated process and low productivity, the development of this field was affected.

In previous works, the research group found that N-deacylase for glycosphingolipid of Shewanella algaG8 which is from the marine bacteria can high-effective catalyze the biphasic response of degradation and synthesis of glycosphingolipid chains, which has an important application potential in the synthesis of lyso-glycosphingolipid （Appl Microbiol Biotechnol, 2015, 99(16), 6715-6726 ). As this enzyme coexist the activity of hydrolysis and synthesis and they will compete against each other in catalyzed reaction, which results in the reaction yield only ranges from 40% to 60%. In this research, the enzymatic reaction system of SCDase was optimized. By introducing high concentrations of alk Li-earth metal ion and proper surfactant, the balance of enzyme reaction was successfully controlled. Under the best condition, the conversion rate of SCDase can increase to over 96%. This method is easy to handle and magnify, the productivity of GM1 in 12 hours can increase to 90%, which is significantly above the best results reported in current literatures (72% productivity in two weeks) and shows a promising application in large-scale production and structure innovation of glycosphingolipid drugs.

 At present, this technology has applied for China's invention patent. The research group is using efficient synthetic activity and wide substrates selectivity of SCDase to promote many different types of fatty-acid chains and lyso-glycosphingolipid compound non-natural glycosphingolipid molecular library, so as to lay the foundation for the development of more glycosphingolipid drugs with higher efficacy.

 

Related Links: http://www.jlr.org/content/early/2015/06/30/jlr.D061176.long

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: China’s First Precision Imaging Magnetic Resonance Settled in Renji Hospital
item.description:
This July, Division of Radiology in Renji Hospital which is affiliated to Shanghai Jiaotong University launched Philips's latest "all-digital" Medical equipment Ingenia 3.0T MRI. This machine bring patients a comfortable high-tech digital medical service accompanied with relaxing music and wonderful visual enjoyment.

The all-digital high-definition Ingenia 3.0T MRI of precise imaging is China's first all-digital magnetic resonance equipment, with revolutionary innovative technologies such as full digital imaging chain, multi-performance large-aperture, four-dimensional multi-source emission and intelligent cruise. With these technologies, not only the scan time is significantly shortened, but also the image quality has been greatly improved. As a result, the clinical field application is greatly expanded.

The application of this new 3.0T MRI scanner will greatly ease the pressure on the patients who need to take MRI examination. Also, it will render more advantages to Renji Hospital within its MRI technology field, which is already quite prominent with a wide range of clinical applications.

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Team JiaoLong of SJTU Won the Second Prize of 2015 Robot World Cup
item.description:
On July, 22, Demonstration Challenge on Benchmarking Service Robots of 2015 Robot World Cup was held in Hefei International Conference Center. The team JiaoLong of SJTU won the second prize beating the University of Tokyo and National University of Singapore. University of Science and Technology of China won the championship.

RoboCup is the world's largest robotics event organizer, the Robot World Cup organized by it is recognized as the top event in the field of robotics as it is the largest, most influential and it is the highest level robot world-class events. The cup is trying to promote the development of artificial intelligence, robotics and related fields, making a series of new technologies and new methods to obtain integration and verification in exploring the practical issues.

Robot World Cup is held annually. Since its inaugural tournament was held in 1997 in Nagoya, Japan, the event has been held 19 sessions. It is the second time for China to hold Robot World Cup this year (Suzhou held the 12th Robot World Cup in 2008). The tournament this year attracted 47 countries worldwide, more than 500 teams, a total of 2223 people participating.

Team JiaoLong was led by supervisors Chen Weidong and Wang Jingchuan from School of Electronic, Information and Electrical Engineering, including doctoral student Liu Zhe, Zhao Wenrui, Liu Li and graduate student Lan Gongwen, Peng Wei from Robots Student Innovation Studio, SJTU.

The Robots Student Innovation Studio, SJTU was founded in 2011 aiming to attract students' interest and train the creative and practical ability of undergraduate and graduate students through the establishment of PRP project, college students' innovative practice projects, internal seminars, technical training innovation and practice.

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Held Summit on 2015 International Image & Communication
item.description:
On July 23, 2015 Shanghai Jiao Tong University Summit on International Image & Communication and Final Round of the 4th English Websites Campion was held in the Information Building on Minhang campus. SJTU Vice President Huang Zhen, Zhu Jian, SBTC Director Simon Stewart, Pan Xun, Commentator of International affairs from Xinhua News Agency, Cheng Ying as well as other relevant officers attended the forum.

In his speech, Huang Zhen said that the 10th Congress of Party Representatives further determined that internationalization is the major strategy to accelerate the construction of world first class universities. He hoped that SJTU could take the opportunity of International Image Communication and Selection Conference, share the cutting-edge idea of media communication with international specialists, study the excellent cases and exchange the experience of constructing English website with colleagues. With higher goals and requirements, we would construct the English homepage and various levels English websites as platforms to demonstrate our teaching, scientific researches and cultural activities to the world.

In this Forum, Simon Stewart, the director of SBTC, gave a speech on universities' international image communication. He believed that the website for information exchanges should accurately analyze the requirements of audiences so as to build his own brand. He also talked about his opinions on the brand construction of universities. All participants hoped that this forum can paly a role in communication, exchanges, promotion and promotion so as to make all of us attach great importance to the construction of English websites, demonstrate and improve the image of Chinese universities by high-level English websites.

In the forum, Huang Zhen and Zhu Jian launched the App of Chinese and English version of SJTU news.

The 4th selection activity for English websites, co-sponsored by Party Committee Propaganda Department and International Cooperation and Exchanges Department, was launched since May 23, attracting 39 departments to participate. After on-site defense and juries' review, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering and Shanhai Jiao T ong University Library won the Best English Website Award, Antai College of Econimics &Managment, School of Aeronautics and Astronautics, School of Mechnical Engineering, Department of Physics and Astronomy, Koguan Law School of Shanghai Jiao Tong University won the Excellent English Websites Award; School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering, School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine, School of International and Public Affairs, School of Materials Science and Engineering, School of Humanities, School of life Sciences and Biotechnology and School of Foreign Language won the Excellent Organization Award. School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering also won the Biggest Fans Award.

 

Translated by Li Ying       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: The Gut Microbiota Was Found a Viable Target for Treating Childhood Genetic Obesity
item.description:
A multi national research team led by Shanghai Jiao Tong University scientists has recently reported a successful clinical trial of a gut microbiota-targeted nutritional therapy for children morbidly obese with a genetic condition, known as Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS). Because of a genetically conditioned food-craving behavior, bodyweight management of children with PWS has previously proven to be extraordinarily difficult.

During the hospitalized 12-week dietary intervention trial, children with PWS lost nearly 20% of their bodyweight without the need for rigorous exercises. They achieved better behavioral control of food cravings, which made it easier for parents to help them continue the diet at home. A 14 year-old PWS volunteer experienced a significant weight loss from 140 kg to 73 kg after 430 days of adherence to the diet.

The interventional diet was based on whole-grains, traditional Chinese medicinal foods and prebiotics. It contained balanced macro- and micro-nutrients to meet the children's nutritional needs. It also provided large amounts of complex carbohydrates that are non-digestible by humans but that feed beneficial bacteria in the gut, allowing them to thrive.

Researchers showed that the pre-intervention gut microbiota induced more fat accumulation than the post-intervention one from the same PWS volunteer when both were transplanted into germfree mice. The team found that the interventional diet significantly improved the gut microbiota and reduced the amount of obesity-related toxins in blood and urine produced by gut bacteria. Particularly, this diet promoted the growth of a beneficial species called Bifidobacterium pseudocatenulatum, which may work as a "foundation species" to promote other beneficial bacteria and reduce toxin-producing ones. Such foundation species are just like tall trees for a rainforest, which can cover the ecosystem and create a unique environment to support the thriving of all other members of a healthy gut microbiota.

All the evidences provided in the paper strengthen the notion that the diet-induced changes of the gut microbiota may have contributed to health improvement of the human hosts. This study opens the possibility of developing an effective nutritional therapy for childhood genetic obesity with the gut microbiota as a primary target.

The paper was published in EBioMedicine.

http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2352396415300645

Contact: Prof Liping Zhao, lpzhao@sjtu.edu.cn

 

 

 

 

 

Source: School of Life Science and Biotechnology

item.title: Pro. Liu Xila Elected as FEIAP Vice-chairman
item.description:
Recently, Professor Liu Xila, from Department of Civil Engineering in School of Naval Architecture, Ocean & Civil Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU), attended the 3rd convention and 23rd GA meeting of Federation of Engineering Institutions of Asia and the Pacific (FEIAP) held in Taipei and was elected as the vice-chairman of FEIAP.

FEIAP is an important engineering organization, in which Pro. Liu Xila has always been a member of the executive committee standing for China Association of Science and Technology. On the 3rd Convention of FEIAP, Pro. Liu Xila delivered two academic reports, namely "Filling the gap between developing and the developed countries" and "Robust design of the structure preventing terrorist attack", which were well received by experts participating the conference.

On the 23rd GA meeting held then, Pro. Liu Xila was elected as the vice chairman of FEIAP. This was the first time for Chinese scholars to hold important positions in FEIAP.

 

Translated by Ling Jie    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Won the Champion of 2000 Meters Eight-Man Straight Race in Racing Boat Competition
item.description:
The first Racing Boat Competition for World Famous Universities was held in Oriental Oasis Water Sport Center today. Teams from prestigious Universities like Oxford, Cambridge, and Yale came to Shanghai and competed with Chinese teams from Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Tsinghua University, and Peking University. In the 2000 meters eight-man straight race, SJTU won the champion in the competition with Oxford and Cambridge.

The first Racing Boat Competition for World Famous Universities attracted twenty-eight universities to participate, with a total number of 350 students. The teams were divided into group A, which included 4 universities in Europe (Yale, Cambridge, Oxford, the University of Sydney), four universities in Asia (Korean, Singapore, Chinese Taiwan, Chinese Hong Kong), and four universities in Mainland China (Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Tsinghua University, Peking University, Wuhan University); and group B, which contains other 16 teams in Shanghai and other provinces.

The racing boat team of SJTU was founded in 2000, and is the key high-level sports team of the university. In 2001, Shanghai Water Sports Center and SJTU jointly established the team. In 2005, the Ministry of Education approved the team to be one of the first batch high-level sports team in universities. Currently, the team includes famous athletes such as He Yi, Zhou Yinan and Xu Lijia. In the meantime, the university authority also picks athletes from other fields.

Chairperson of the PE Department of SJTU Yu Chaoyang mentioned that PE is not only competiton, so we should come back to the essence of education and try to educate students through PE. Racing boat is a product of industrial civilization, which reflects the rules of respect and cooperation. This time's competition could boost the development of SJTU PE session, as well as be a name card of international PE education.

The coach of SJTU racing boat team Yang Yiming said that as early as in 2001, SJTU has been competing with Tsinghua University and Peking University. In the past ten years, the SJTU team has experienced great growth and performed as a representative of China to participate Universiade and so on.

 

 

Translated by Li Ying    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Prof. Leo KoGuan Was Invited to Participate in the 1st Summit of Chinese Judicial Studies Association
item.description:
On July 4th 2015, The 1st Summit of Chinese Judicial Studies Association was ceremoniously held in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. The theme of this summit is "The History, Present, and Future of Chinese Judiciary." Prof. Leo KoGuan, Founding Council Member of Chinese Judicial Studies Association, Honorary Trustee of Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Honorary Professor of KoGuan Law School, and the Director of KoGuan International Rule of Law and Principle Studies Center, was invited to participate in this summit and gave a significant speech entitled as XY". Mr. Zhou Qiang, President of the Supreme People's Court and President of Chinese Judicial Studies Association, also attended the summit and addressed the conference. 

With great passion, Prof. Leo KoGuan eloquently stated that Xuan Yuan is the first leader, first comprehensive physician, first environmentalist, and first human right lawyer of mankind. Therefore, he calls for people to reach the Chinese consensus that Xuan Yuan is our Glorious and Remarkable Ancestor, the Father of Chinese culture and civilization, and the Founder of Culture-State China since 1XY; Xuan Yuan Thought is the source and origin of Chinese hundreds of schools of thought, as well as all myriad thoughts of billions of Chinese people for about 5,000 years.

Before his speech, Prof. Leo KoGuan was also invited to visit the Supreme Court and met Chief Justice Zhou Qiang.

 

KoGuan Law School

item.title: 19th SJTU VOS Evening Party Reveals Stories of the Graduates
item.description:
On the evening of July 3, the 19th VOS graduation party "Stories" was held in the stadium on Minghang campus. Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian and President Zhang Jie attended the evening party.

Before the beginning of the party, Jiang Sixian gave a speech to all the graduates. He shared his own stories in SJTU, and expressed his keen expectation for the graduates. At last, Jiang Sixian asked students to go back to the campus at times.

On the evening party, all the graduates finished their last lesson in SJTU. During the party, fantastic performance and videos interwove, which led the graduates to recollect all the details of their campus life. Four years' time is such a short period, that all those young faces four years ago were like they just appeared yesterday. The dancing performance from the Association of International Standard Dancing was very enthusiastic, and taekwondo performance reminded students of their military training in the hot summer of 2012. All those songs and dance pushed the party to a climax. In the video "Ordinary People", all the graduates memorized their way through this four years, and were touched to tears. At last, in the melody of the song "Goodbye", all of the audience stood up, and the party for the 3700 graduates approached to its end. Everyone was reluctant to leave, and embraced people around, hoping that the time would last longer.

Looking back to the past four years, the most touching memory about youth was in them. The graduation party may be a final chapter of the F11ers, but it was also the opening of a new story. Hope all graduates could write more splendid stories in their future.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU 2015 Undergraduates Graduation Ceremony Grandly Held
item.description:
In the morning of July 5, 2015, SJTU 2015 Graduation Ceremony for undergraduates was held on Minhang Campus. Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian, President Zhang Jie, Vice Presidents Guo Xinli, Lin Zhongqin, Sun Dalin, Wu Dan, Zhu Jian, Zhang Ansheng, Xu Xuemin, outstanding alumna Ye Jun graduated in 1988, member of the US National Academy of Sciences, as well as teachers, students and parents attended the ceremony. The ceremony was hosted by Xu Xuemin.

President Zhang Jie delivered the speech titled "Love lets us go on". He spoke to the graduates as follows: "You need to find out what you love because your love would be the power to pursue what you want. You need to love your life, your family and your career."

President Zhu Jian announced "Shanghai outstanding graduates list" and "Shanghai Jiaotong University graduates employed by Midwest key units list."

On the ceremony, outstanding alumna Ye Jun graduated in 1988, member of the US National Academy of Sciences shared his "beautiful youth" at SJTU and expressed his hope that all the SJTU graduates would be gratitude, responsible, enthusiastic and hopeful.

On behalf of all the SJTU gratuates, Ren Qingyu from School of Electronic, Information and Electrical Engineering shared his understanding towards life in SJTU and his dream.

At the ceremony, graduates from different college stood up as a unit in turn after their dean submitted to Zhang Jie the list of college students who earned a degree in 2015.Then the name list was read out by President Zhang Jie and all the graduates were congratulated by Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian and President Zhang Jie.

The graduates gave a Marble carving of a book as present to SJTU.

Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian announced the 120th Anniversary Logo. He pointed out three sentenced to the graduates "Don't forget your original intention." "Knowledge and action should go hand in hand.""Be Diligent and Enterprising."

 

At the end of the ceremony, all the graduates stood up and sang in unison the School Song of Shanghai Jiao Tong University.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Renji Hospital, SJTU First Proposes Criteria for Grading Cardiac Trauma after AMI
item.description:
In recent years, along with increased incidence of coronary heart disease, acute myocardial infarction (AMI) has become a serious threat to human longevity. The high incidence drives the improvements of AMI emergency care, which help prolong patients' life. Therefore, rehabilitation and working ability assessment of AMI patients are gaining importance. However, there is no concise grading and assessment system for cardiac damage level after AMI in clinical practice. Recently, Prof. He Ben, Cardiology expert at Renji Hospital of SJTU School of Medicine, first proposed a new criteria for grading cardiac trauma after AMI, which attracted widespread attention in academic circles from home and abroad. The research findings of Prof. He Ben's team are published online in PLOS ONE (PLoS One. 2015 Jun 19;10(6):e0130158.) Preliminary research findings show that, the new grading criteria is an independent predictor of MI patients' poor prognoses. He believes that in the future, with the popularization of the new grading criteria, every AMI patient is expected to have their own grading early-warning signs after discharged from hospital. The early-warning sign is just like meteorological early-warning, it can keep patients aware of their health status, moreover, help different medical institutions and physicians to communicate patients' condition, promote better registration and management of patients with coronary heart disease and provide scientific and accurate index for working ability assessment.

Related link: http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0130158

 

 

 

Translated by Wang Tifan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: A Cooperation Agreement Signed by SJTU, Ghent University and Catholic university of Louvain
item.description:
On the evening of 25 June 2015, on the occasion of Belgium King Philip, Queen Mathilde's visit to Shanghai, Foreign Affairs Office of Shanghai government and representatives of the Belgian Consulate General held a bilateral cooperation agreement signing ceremony among universities, research institutions and relevant government departments.

On behalf of Shanghai Jiaotong University, Zhang Jie, president of SJTU, signed a cooperation agreement with Ghent University, Belgium and Catholic University of Louvain.

Ghent University, Belgium is one of the major Belgian universities in the Dutch-speaking region of Europe. On September 7, 2013, Zhang Jie and Cauwenberg, the school principal of Ghent University, Belgium signed protocol to establish a "Shanghai Jiaotong University - Ghent University fungal toxins Joint Laboratory". In order to further strengthen cooperation, after the two sides have conducted fruitful cooperation and published more than 20 papers, both sides proposed to add the Shanghai Institute for Biological Sciences, CAS as partner to build a joint laboratory and signed the "Ghent University - Shanghai Jiaotong University - the Shanghai Institute for Biological Sciences, CAS Agreement."

Catholic University of Louvain and Antai College of Economics and Management, Shanghai Jiaotong University, have undergone long-term relationship. Since 2007 more than 10 EMBA students of Catholic University of Louvain have a week of study tours to ACEM each year and the two sides also exchanged a dozen MBA students and graduate students each year. School of Foreign Languages, Shanghai Jiaotong University also has research cooperation in English linguistics with Catholic University of Louvain. In late December, the delegation of School of Medicine, SJTU visited Catholic University of Louvain to discuss cooperation. The inter-school cooperation agreement signed by the two universities will further promote bilateral cooperation and exchanges in various fields.

In the afternoon, Vincent Blondel, president and Veronique Preat, vice president of Catholic University of Louvain visited Antai College of Economics and Management and discussed cooperation with Dean Zhou Lin, Associate Dean Wan Guohua, Antai College of Economics and Management

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Young SJTU Alumni Won Jinjue Prize of 18th Shanghai International Film Festival
item.description:
Recently, on the awarding ceremony of 18th Shanghai International Film Festival, the Chinese documentary My Psalm won the newly established Jinjue Prize for the best documentary, standing out of five films from four countries in the shortlist.

The creating team of My Psalm is a very young one, with three SJTU alumni as the core members. The Director Wu Feiyue and Superintendent Bai Yandong are the first batch of graduates from SJTU School of Media and Design. The producer Cai Qingzeng was graduated from SJTU School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering. The film focuses on six most ordinary workers, recounting their happiness and sadness in their daily work and life. In My Psalm, the Chinese workers who have always been neglected by the public became the protagonist this time, and are respected by the outside world.

When the good news of My Psalm came, Chairperson of the University Council Jiang TransSixian and President Zhang Jie congratulated the three. The Dean of Department of Film and Television Li Yizhong recollected that "the class where Wu Feiyue was in was very active. After graduation, Wu Yuefei worked very hard and realized his dream of Movie. His work is more about humane care and responsibility then skills, and thus has rich implications to the current students."

It is reported that My Psalm will go around the country to demonstrate, and the first station is SJTU. Wu Yuefei said that he would continue to make the second and the third one, and make the voice of Chinese workers heard by more people in the world.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Develops New Intelligent Method for Responsive Phospholipids and Liposomes
item.description:
Recently, Professor Zhu Xinyuan from SJTU School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, collaborating with Professor Wang Wenxin from University College Dublin, has developed a new method for the preparation of simple new intelligent responsive phospholipids and liposomes. Relevant research was published on 14th June, 2015 with the title of "Supramolecularly Engineered Phospholipids Constructed by Nucleobase Molecular Recognition: Upgraded Generation of Phospholipids for Drug Delivery" in the internationally renowned journal in chemical field "Chemical Science". Chemistry World website of Royal Society of Chemistry has made a systematic introduction to the above works with the title of "DNA Inspires Smart Phospholipids.

The study provided a new idea to addressing the key issues in the field of phospholipid research. These new intelligent materials can also be used in bio-medicine, bio-imaging and other fields. Related content has applied for Chinese patents. Professor Theresa Allen, medicine expert at the University of Alberta spoke highly of the work, regarding this creative new method as a promising way to get the liposomes while realizing the controllable releasing of the cargo in vivo.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan        Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Admission and Opening Time for 2015 Dragon Boat Festival
item.description:
Admission and Opening Time for 2015 Dragon Boat Festival

To better serve the public, the Museum will stay all open during the Dragon-Boat Festival (Duanwu, June 20-22). The Museum opens from 9:00-17:00 with the last entry at 16:30. 

 

Tsien Hsueshen Library

item.title: Zhang Dabing Team Discloses Origin of New Plant Gene and New Mechanism
