item.description:
Recently, the Molecular Plant, sub-journal of world famous botany journal Cell officially released the latest research result of Professor Zhang Dabing's team from School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU),which was named "Young Genes out of the Male: An Insight from Evolutionary Age Analysis of the Pollen Transcriptome". This research proposed that new plant gene stem from male's germ cell, providing new theory and proof for the born of plant's new gene.

This research disclosed evolution model that might exist for higher animal and angiosperm: numerous andro gametes produced by male gential organ had higher heritable variation level. The competition occurred in generative propagation is used to screen more adaptive heritable variation form (including new gene) so  that it could provide motive power for improving species' environmental suitability and the defensive power against pathogene. This research would help to explain the evolutionary implications of generative propagation.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Researchers Publish Review Paper on Chemical Society Reviews
item.description:
Recently, a research review article titled "Suspension arrays based on nanoparticle-encoded microspheres for high-throughput multiplexed detection" was published online in Chemical Society Reviews, an internationally renowned journal. (2014 impact factor is 30.425). The article, written by Professor Sun Kang and Associate Professor Li Wanwan from School of Materials Science and Engineering at SJTU, comprehensively summarized the research progress regarding nanoparticle-encoded microspheres worldwide. It also discussed the research approach concerning the design and construction of high-performance nanoparticle-encoded microspheres in depth, and looked into the future of this area. This paper could provide significant reference for research into materials, chemistry, medicine, biology, optical instruments and nanotechnology and other related areas.

For the past few years, the team of Sun and Li have conducted researches into the design and preparation of new functional micro-and-nano materials and their application in biological diagnosis and treatment. The team also published research papers in high-level journals such as Advanced Materials, ACS Nano, Small and Biomaterials, etc. Their researches have been funded by National Natural Science Foundation of China, Ph.D. Programs Foundation of Ministry of Education of China, International Cooperation Projects of Shanghai Municipal Science and Technology Commission, and Shanghai Municipal Natural Science Foundation, etc.

Chemical Society Reviews is a top journal for first-level disciplines published by Royal Society of Chemistry and is acknowledged as one of the most influential and authoritative review journals in the field of chemistry and chemical engineering worldwide.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Academician Mei Hong Wins Technical Achievement Award of IEEE CS
item.description:
On the evening of June 3 local time, 2015 IEEE Computer Society (IEEE CS) Awarding Ceremony was held in Atlanta, USA. Mei Hong, an academician of Shanghai Jiao Tong University, won the Technical Achievement Award for his outstanding contributions to component-based software reuse and standardization.  

There are four scholars won this prize this year, and the others are Pro. Joydeep Ghosh of the University of Texas at Austin, Prof. Krishnendu Chakrabarty of Duke University and Professor Josep Torrellas of University of Illinois Urbana Champaign.  

Technical Achievement Award of IEEE CS was set up in 1985 for commending the scholars who have made outstanding contributions to Computer and Information Science & Engineering or in Computer Technology over the past 10 years (less than 15 years), which remarkably promotes the progress of the field. 

Related Readings：IEEE Computer Society Honors Accomplishments of Four Renowned Technologists

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying              Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Antai EDP Tops the List in Asia
item.description:
On the morning of May 18, the Financial Times of Britain announced the global ranking list for executive training programs. EDP (Executive Development Program) of Antai College of Economics and Management (Antai), SJTU, ranked 15th. It ranked first in Asian Business School. Five core indicators of the EDP program were ranked top ten globally, "Future Use" ranked the first, "Follow Up" ranked second, "Value for Money" ranked the fourth, "Teaching Materials"  ranked the Sixth and "Faculty" ranked the tenth. Apart from Antai, three other business schools from China were in the list, including China Europe International Business School, Guanghua School of Management at Peking University and Sun Yat-Sen Business School.   

Zhou Lin, Dean of the college, says that Antai's success in the list indicated that it had become one of the best colleges in senior management, and it also indicated the sustained development; of senior management of China.

Wu Dan, Vice President of SJTU, pointed out that the supporting data for the ranking list were provided objectively by cooperative partners. So, the results could be a genuine significance to the analysis of comprehensive strengths of business schools and the selection of suitable business schools of clients. He also says that SJTU had always regarded it as one of its key tasks to serve the society and that EDP, as an important window to provide social service, should better facilitate the society and enterprises by providing independent, academic and professional advice and talent training modes and eventually make an outstanding executive training platform with "Chinese wisdom and international vision".

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Alumni Shang-Hua Teng Wins Gödel Prize
item.description:
On May 27th local time, ACM SIGACT announced that SJTU's alumni graduated from Electrical and Computer Science major, professor at the University of Southern California Shang-Hua Teng won the Gödel Prize again. This is also his second time cooperating with Yale professor Dan Spielman and wining Gödel Prize. Their co-authored paper has won Gödel Prize in 2008. This time they are awarded because of their series papers in terms of near-linear time Laplace solver.

Shang-Hua Teng graduated from SJTU in 1985 with a double bachelor's degree in electrical engineering and computer science and then get his master's and doctor's degree in the University of Southern California and Carnegie Mellon University. He had taught in MIT, University of Minnesota, Illinois Urbana - Champaign and Boston University. Shang-Hua Teng was elected in 2009 to be the Fellow American Association for Computing Machinery (ACM fellow), and in the same year, he won the Fulkerson Prize awarded by American Mathematical Society and the American Mathematical Planning Society.

Gödel Prize was jointly established in 1993 by European Computer Society (EATCS) and ACM SIGACT. It is the highest prize in the field of theoretical computing awarded to the most outstanding theoretical computer science papers. Up to now, Shang-Hua Teng was the only award-winning Chinese scholar.

It is reported that the award will be issued in Oregon during the ACM Symposium on Computer which will be held from June 14th to 17th, 2015.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Team Finds New Treatment of Water Pollution
item.description:
In recent years, the problem of water pollution has been very severe. Water pollution badly impacts the life of residents near the bank and downstream, and one of the most damaging factors is heavy material. But how can it be removed? The first thing to do should be to control the source. But enterprises are not willing to do so because of the high cost.

Currently, materials which can absorb heavy metal are acticarbon, polymergel, exchange resin and so on, yet the effects are all ordinary. How to find a highly effective and low-cost absorbent? Research fellow Li Liang and his team from SJTU School of Environmental Science and Engineering found a new quantum dot absorbent, which can effectively solve this problem.

Develop new field of sewage treating with the help of "quantum dot"

How did Li Liang find that the "quantum dot" can be used to solve the problem of water pollution? Before he came back to China, Li Liang had always been doing research of the application of quantum dot. After entering SJTU to work, he combined his research direction and the status quo of the current water pollution problem, and developed the non-toxic absorbent with his team. However, the difficulty of separation posts another problem.

The emerging of magnetic "quantum dot absorbent" solves the difficulty of separation

The team of Li Liang finally found a suitable carrier. The "advanced" magnetic quantum dot absorbent could separate and recycle effectively in the premise of maintaining the original absorbing amount.

Is the absorbent very expensive then? Although the price of quantum dot absorbent is higher than ordinary absorbents, but the absorbing amount is dozens of times than ordinary absorbents and thus the using amount is much less.

Currently the research has applied for five patents, and Li Liang's team also cooperated with corporates to expand the production capacity. In the current conditions, they can make absorbent which could absorb 5 kilograms per hour. In the near future, it is possible that the absorbent could be mass produced.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTUers Realize “Brain Control Cockroach”
item.description:
Science fiction film Avatar made up the scientific dream of biologically controlling allograft through "brain-brain interface" technique. A few days ago, this dream was realized by Laboratory for Bio Robotics and Biological Robots in Robotics Institute, School of mechanical and power engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU). Under the guidance of Zhang Dingguo, postgraduate student Li Guangye controlled a living cockroach with human mind, which has won the second prize in 2015 IEEE RAS students' video contest and would be exhibited in the top-level meeting ICRA2015.

The research establishes the functional "brain-brain interface" between human and cockroach, sending signal of human mind to the brain of cockroach and realizing the remote wireless control of cockroach's action. Controller wears a portable wireless brain wave collecting device and their mind will have a directional intention based on the visual feedback and the visual stimulation; the computer will decode the brain wave received and recognize the directional intention of the controller, then transfer it into controlling signal and send it to the electronic backpack receiver on the back of the cockroach; microelectrode has been planted into the antennae nerve in the head of the cockroach, which produces a controllable living "machine animal". By virtue of the Bluetooth communication technology, controller could form a wireless communication between the computer and the electronic backpack which will receive the commanding signal from the controller's mind and send specific electric pulse to the antennal nerve of the cockroach through intrusive electrical nerve stimulation technique so to realize the controlling of cockroach by human beings.

This research realized the controlling of living cockroach to walk in S-shaped path and Z-shaped path by human mind. They pointed out that this research extended the traditional brain-computer interface technology and tentatively attempted the avatar brain-brain communication. In the future, this could also be used for complex terrain reconnaissance, risk-elimination and so on, and also lay a solid foundation for the uprising of brainwork.

It is reported that the researcher will still upgrade the controlling mode to realize the controlling of several cockroaches by several controllers at the same time.

 

Attachment: award-winning video links

http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XOTYyMjc2NDQ0.html

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU and GM China Jointly Launched Pilot Project of Electric Concept Car
item.description:
On May 27, Shanghai Jiao Tong University and General Motors China (GM China) officially launched the two-year joint pilot project of sharing cars. Currently, 16 Chevrolet EN-V 2.0 electric concept cars are already in operation.

To save energy, protect the environment and choose a low carbon way of commuting is a significant link in the basic state policy concerning the safety of energy and reducing waste emission. In these aspects, the promotion of new energy cars is of vital importance. Besides, electrification, intellectualization, and informatization are strategic directions of the global development of cars, in which unmanned driving and the telematics are important directions. In order to promote the development of advanced technology and act in accordance of the government's call-up, SJTU launched the building up of green campus network in 2012.

In order to promote the implement of relevant works, SJTU built up the new energy car data center, which currently has already the functions of collecting, monitoring, analyzing, and data mining abilities, and could provide service to the society. These have made a good foundation for the development of new energy car technology, the promotion, and the study of commercial mode. Apart from these, SJTU has also set 128 stakes on the campus of Minhang, Xuhui, and Fahua, and the personal new energy car has exceeded 100.

As a famous mobile company in the world, GM has been devoted in the study of electrification, intellectualization, and unmanned driving of small electric car. The ideas of development of GM and SJTU coincide with each other, and this is the first step of the two sides' cooperation.

Vice President of SJTU Wu Dan mentioned that SJTU extremely values the cooperation with GM. Global vice executive officer and CEO of GM China Matt Tsien said that this project would help the company to better evaluate the practical utilization of Chevrolet EN-V 2.0 as city mobile equipment, which is the first step to realize the sustainable city commuting way.

It is reported that those who want to rent the EN-V 2.0 must have driving license, have the need of car in daily life, and have interests in new energy cars. Now the project is calling for members, who should be teaching staff or students with an educational background higher than bachelor.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: New book on Tokyo Trials launched at BEA 2015
item.description:
A China-published new book on the Tokyo Trials of Japanese war criminals in World War II made its world debut here Thursday at the largest annual book fair in the United States.

The 50-volume book in Japanese, titled "Collection of Court Exhibits of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East", displays court-accepted evidence submitted by both the prosecution and defense at the tribunal convened at Tokyo, Japan, also known as the Tokyo Trials.

 

Court-accepted evidence in the Tokyo Trials.

 

The publication of the book, a full record and review of war crimes committed by Japanese militarists in China and other countries in East Asia during World War II, is of historical value and meant to highlight the importance to cherish and maintain world peace and order, according to the Chinese editors' foreword.

The Tokyo Trials were held from May 1946 to November 1948 in order to punish Japanese war criminals and restore international order in accordance with the Potsdam Declaration.

"The tribunal heard the testimony from 419 witnesses and admitted 4,336 exhibits," said Xiang Longwan, honorary director of the Tokyo Trials research center at Shanghai Jiao Tong University.

The exhibits included depositions, documents, diaries, letters and reports, said the scholar, whose father Xiang Zhejun was among the Tokyo Trials prosecutors.

Aggregating and organizing all of them into a book took labor.

"I actually got my first glimpse of this publication when I was wondering through the exhibit halls yesterday. My eye always goes to big publications, because I know just what it takes to bring out just a work," said Karen Christensen, CEO of the Berkshire Publishing Group, a U.S. partner of Shanghai Jiao Tong University Press.

This big publication is a co-work between Shanghai Jiao Tong University Press and the publishing house of the National Library of China.

Its world premiere at the Book Expo America (BEA) 2015 represented joint efforts by academic and publishing circles of both China and the United States to safeguard postwar order, said Wu Shangzhi, deputy director of the State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television, of China.

"China and the Unites States fought together in World War II, and both participated in the Tokyo Trials," the Chinese official added.

BEA 2015 is scheduled to run at the Javits Convention Center in the New York City from Wednesday to Friday.

China, an emerging power in the international publishing industry, takes part as the Guest of Honor for BEA 2015's Global Market Forum program, which features three days of education sessions, exhibitions and off-site cultural events.

 

 

 

Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU President Zhang Jie Attends 2015 Innovative City Scientist Party
item.description:
Building Shanghai into a global innovative center has become a most expected goal in Shanghai. Recently, Academician of Chinese Academy of Sciences and SJTU President Zhang Jie was invited to "Super Parents", a special program of Shanghai Science and Technology Festival Forum, and attended the 2015 Innovation Capital Scientist Party. He had chatted with adolescents about scientific ideals and innovation power.

Referring to Shanghai's goal to build a global science and innovation center, President Zhang Jie started with the topic with the question of "What Shanghai will be like 15 years later?" He shared his anticipation of Shanghai in 2030. These anticipations includes: intelligent Shanghai in the "Internet +" era; Shanghai's manufacturing in the "Internet +" era; healthy Shanghai in the "Internet +" era; financial Shanghai in the "Internet +" era; Shanghai talents in the "Internet +" era; and Shanghai's environment in the "Internet +" era.

Zhang Jie also had face to face discussion with three students on their creative invention / theoretical studies (including airport bird controller, mathematical conjecture and self-cleaning glass). Zhang Jie hopes that students could keep their curiosity, and constantly pursue their dreams. He encouraged all students who are interested in doing scientific research, to not only pursue scientific achievements, but also to maintain a humane care and a love for the world, so as to do something beneficial to mankind. 

Source: Shanghai TV news channel 2015.05.23 Super Parents

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Experts of CTI Evaluated SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology
item.description:
From May 18 to 20, the experts of CTI visited SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology to evaluate and inspect its qualification in issuing the diploma for engineers. Jiang Sixian, the chairperson of the University Council, and President Zhang Jie met with the experts respectively.

CTI, founded in 1934, is an independent non-executive institution affiliated with the French Ministry of Education under the law. It takes charge of evaluating and inspecting the qualification of colleges and universities in issuing a diploma for engineers and grants its authorizations to them, thus making these certified universities have rights to issue the academic certificate that is approved by the French Ministry Education. 

After listening to the report of overall work made by Cédric DENIS-REMIS, the French dean of SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology, and Li Ping & Liu Zenglu, the assistant dean of SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology, the experts have a good understanding of its development strategy, management structure, training objective, cultivating mode, curriculum system, quality control, teaching staff, admission situation, the quality of candidates and university-industry cooperation etc.. In addition, the experts discussed and communicated with the coordinators of various disciplines, office directors, representatives of industries and students in some issues, such as situation of teaching and internal management and so on.

The experts believed that SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology set a good example for the educational cooperation between China and French for it has made outstanding achievements since it was founded three years ago. They also believed that this would play a significant role in improving the education of engineers in China. With great confidence of the SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology, they hoped that the institute would make greater achievements in the future.

Jiang Sixian expressed his thanks to the hard work and valuable advices provided by the experts of CTI and he hoped, with confidence of the cooperation, that the institute could pass the certification successfully. President Zhang Jie pointed that SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology is an important cooperation project in engineering education between France and China, the CTI certification would play a crucial role in promoting SJTU's nationalization of engineering education.

CTI certification is an important milestone to inspect the development and teaching quality of SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology and it has a great influence on the "Education and Training Outstanding Engineers" of SJTU and the engineering education in China. Taking this opportunity, SJTU-ParisTech Elite Institute Technology will continuously seek innovation, further improve its brand value and make greater efforts to cultivate outstanding and international elites.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Leads Trends in Intelligent Interactive Voice Controlled Technology
item.description:
During May 18 to 20, Sino-German bilateral seminar on computer-aided feedback method used in second language acquisition and oral training was held in SJTU. Experts and scholars of research institutes and related industry at home and abroad attended and discussed about latest development in intelligent speech technology and its potential applications in computer-aided oral training.

The joint laboratory of SJTU and AISpeech-Artificial Intelligent Speech Center conducted a series of joint projects and research on intelligent interactive voice technology based on big data in the mobile internet era. They have carried research on cognitive man-machine dialogue system technology, technical voice recognition system oriented to the intelligent user dialogue, so that no matter people are in the car, home or other more complex conditions, they can freely use smooth voice, anywhere, anytime to order natural language intelligent interactive dialogue robot to complete the task.

 intelligent interactive voice controlled audio equipment

Yu Kai, professor of School of Electronic, Information and Electrical Engineering, "Orientalist" expert, director of the joint laboratory of SJTU and AISpeech-Artificial Intelligent Speech Center said that this dialog system with adapting and thinking skills is no longer the traditional speech recognition technology, but a human voice robot.

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Space Engine Settled Down in Qian Xuesen Library
item.description:
On May 17th, the ceremony for the space engine of manned space in China and Chang'e lunar exploration project settling in Qian Xuesen Library was held in B13 academic communication hall of Qian Xuesen Library. Two space engines designed and developed by 801 Research Laboratory of the 6th School, China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation, were officially settled down in Qian Xuesen Library.

These two space engines of manned space in China and Chang'e lunar exploration project were respectively 490N engine used in Chang'e lunar exploration project, Beidou Satellite project and other projects and 2500N engine used in Shenzhou Manned Spaceships. Currently, 2500N binary engine was the largest space liquid rocket engine used for satellites and spaceships and the orbit control engine of Shenzhou manned spacecraft, providing power for spaceship orbital transfer maneuver, return braking, and escaping and lifesaving. So far, it has completed ten flight missions of Shenzhou manned spaceship successfully.

The settling of these two space engines in Qian Xuesen Library was not only meant to exhibit the great achievements of manned space in China and Chang'e lunar exploration project, but also meant to show respect for Qian Xuesen who devoted himself to the development of China's manned spacecraft engineering.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Affiliated Children’s Medical Center Solved Relapse Issue of Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
item.description:
Recently, the research group consisting of lots of scientific research scientists home and abroad, such as personnels from Shanghai Jiao Tong University(SJTU) of Medicine Affiliated Shanghai Children's Medical Center (SCMC) and National Human Genome South Research Center, found for the first time all over the world that PRPS1 gene mutation was one of the most important reasons for the patients of Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia to have drug resistance and relapse, which was verified by clinical data from China, Germany and so on. The world leading academic journals Nature Medicine released this research result on May 11th online. And this was the first time for China's Department of Pediatrics to publish academic works as the first author and corresponding author.

It was learned that Nature Medicine would officially publish this research paper in the June 2nd periodical.

Experts believed that the research result of SCMC did not only provide new theoretical basis for drug resistance and relapse mechanism of Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia, but also lay important research and development basis for accurate medical research including early prediction, early intervene and new drug development and so on. It was also expected to lift the recovery rate of Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia in China from current 70%.

This research result was highly praised by several top-level experts in relating field globally. It was learnt that the research had received strongly support from Professor Ching-Hon Pui, Professor Chen Hongzhuan, Professor Jiang Zhongyi; academician Chen Zhu, famous domestic hematology expert, was also concerned about the process and gave detailed guidance. This research also received strong support from lots of scientific research institution home and abroad.

Jiang Zhongyi said that to fulfill the plan of making Shanghai an internationally influential scientific and research center, SCMC would start a new clinical transformation research on the basis of this research result, including the research and development of drug resistance and relapse early intervene diagnosis technique and new drug. Meanwhile, to effectively respond to the treatment of leukemia relapse patients, the hospital decided to set up a stem cell transplantation and immune cell therapy clinical (research) center and strengthen cooperation with internationally famous pediatric tumor authority.

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Professor Xiangdong Ji Awarded 2015 Jefferson Outstanding Nuclear Physicist
item.description:
Recently, the United States Jefferson Science Associates, LLC announced that the 2015 Outstanding Nuclear Physicist was awarded to Professor Xiangdong Ji from SJTU and Professor Anatoly Radyushkin from Old Dominion University - Jefferson National Laboratory, in recognition of their pioneering contributions to the theoretical research of  generalized parton distribution and the discovery and experiment in deeply virtual compton scattering.

 

Jefferson Outstanding Physicist Award was founded in 2011 and was awarded every two years, aiming to award those individuals who have made continuous contributions to the theoretical and experimental research in nuclear physics. It is now one of the most internationally recognized honors in nuclear physics research.

Jefferson Award Committee highly recognized Professor Xiangdong Ji's and Professor Anatoly Radyushkin's outstanding contributions in the study of hadron theory. The committee cited in the news the internationally renowned physicist in hadron theory and Stanford University Professor Brodsky: "Professor Xiangdong Ji and Professor Anatoly Radyushkin are among the most outstanding physicists worldwide in the fields of hadron physics, nuclear physics and quantum chromodynamics, their innovative research will have a profound impact on the development of physics and nuclear physics of hadrons.

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: The Donation Ceremony of Documents from Zhang Yuanji and Li Ruihua
item.description:
On May 11, Zhang Long, the entropy granddaughter of Zhang Yuanji, the second president of SJTU as well as the wife of Li Ruihua, alumni of SJTU together with Zhang Renfeng, brother of Li Ruihua, donated documents of Zhang Yuanji and Li Ruihua to School History Museum of Shanghai Jiaotong University.  Sheng Yi, director of Research Office of School History museum accepted donations, and expressed gratitude for their enthusiastic support of the construction of new Wen Bo Building.

Zhang Long donated Li Ruihua's writings, letters of appointment, photographs, certificates, inscriptions with a total of more than 20 pieces, including Zhang Yuanji and Rui Hua's title signed photo in his later years as well as Li Ruihua's memoir. These precious school history literature not only demonstrates the pragmatic spirit of SJTU but also showed us a great model of "when you drink water, never shall you forget its source and you should love your motherland and bring honor to your almamater."

In 2016, SJTU will celebrate its 120th anniversary, the new Wenbo building will be completed in 2017, School History Museum is now in full swing at home and abroad calling for alumni to present extensive collection of school history. The precious document donated this time will be an important part of school history and will add luster to the deep historical heritage of SJTU.

Zhang Ruihua was the president of SJTU and Li Ruihua was the grandson-in-law of Zhang Ruihua. He graduated from the School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering , SJTU and he was responsible for hundreds of large-scale military and civilian steel works, including the Great Hall, the Capital Gymnasium. Li Ruihua is regarded as the pioneer and leader of the metal structure design research.

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Students Awarded Outstanding Winner in MCM/ICM
item.description:
Recently, the official website of Mathematical Contest in Modeling (MCM) and Interdisciplinary Contest in Modeling (ICM) announced the 2015 final competition results. The team of Li Wenxin, Zhao Zijing and You Jie from School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering at SJTU were awarded the Outstanding Winner in ICM, which was the very Outstanding Winner this year among all universities in Shanghai.

This year, altogether 187 teams from SJTU participated in the competition, with one team winning the Outstanding Winner, 31 the Meritorious Winner and 69 the Honorable Mention. The total number of prize winners increases greatly compared to that of past years.

The 2015 MCM and ICM were held from February 5 to February 9, which have attracted 9773 teams from 16 countries and regions to participate. 19 teams won the "Outstanding Award" in total.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: New Progress Made by SJTU in BMS Design Theory for Power Lithium-ion Battery
item.description:
Recently, under the support of National Natural Science Foundation of China，973 Program, Assistant Professor He Yijun, Professor Ma Zifeng from School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering at SJTU made new progress in the design theory of Battery Management System (BMS) for power lithium-ion battery. Related research findings have been published on AIChE Journal (AIChE Journal，2015，doi:10.1002/aic.14760) .

Based on the researches into fuel cells, carbon dioxide capture, design theory  for multi-target and uncertainty of storage system (Fuel Cells, 2013,13(3)：321-335；Industrial & Engineering Chemistry Research, 2014, 53, 778-785；Chemometrics and Intelligent Laboratory Systems, 2014, 135, 37-47), and facing BMS related problems like how to make lithium-ion battery operate with safety and endurance, He Yijun, Ma Zifeng and other researchers combined the design of complex chemical processes with characteristics of multi-target and uncertainty with Operational optimization theory and applied them in the research into the design theory of BMS, and managed to established a lithium-ion battery equivalent circuit model. Besides, they developed in MATLAB software a single lithium-ion battery Simscape simulation platform, which helped implement model parameter identification and dynamic simulation. Additionally, they first proposed a polynomial open-circuit voltage mode based on nonlinear semi-infinite programming, which was an overt integration of Monotonic priori knowledge of OCV and SOC with the modelling process. Last but not least, they presented a global optimization method that could ensure OCV model in question satisfy monotone relationship and help to improve the accuracy and stability of the prediction made through SOC (Industry & Engineering Chemistry Research,2015, 54 (12):3167-3174).

The modelling idea embodies in this research is a universal method in that this model, as a pure data-driven modeling approach, it could help to surmount defects like difficulty in parameter calibration, large-scale complex calculation and real-time application going hand in hand with the current models.

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Wind Band Won Gold Award Again in National Performance
item.description:
The three-day 9th China Cup Non-professional Excellent Wind Band Performance made a great success in Shanghai. The wind band of Shanghai Jiao Tong University won the gold award of the College Group. Yao Di, the conductor of the band, was awarded the Excellent Conductor Prize.

China Cup Non-professional Excellent Wind Band Performance, co-sponsored by the organizing committee of Shanghai Spring International Music Festival and band association of Chinese Musicians Association ect., is the biggest event in the domestic field of wind band. This activity attracted 80 delegations from 19 provinces, including 5500 musicians. What's more, ten professional wind bands joined in the performance, including Military Band of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, showed the artistic charm of wind music.

SJTU wind band had joined in the 4th and 6th China Cup Non-professional Excellent Wind Band Performance and won the gold award twice. The wind band has been nearly one hundred years in SJTU and it has been three decades since being restored in 1985. Wind band and orchestra have played an active role in promoting the development of campus culture and improving undergraduates' quality. Over the past three decades, the wind band has won the gold award twice in the international band competitions and won several gold awards in the national band competitions, winning a high reputation for SJTU. Under the concern and guidance of the Committee of Art Education of SJTU, the wind band will make persistent efforts and make another greater success. 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Students Win Grand Prize of "2015 Microsoft Innovation Cup" in Chinese District
item.description:
The Chinese regional final of "Imagine Cup 2015" organized by Microsoft (China) Company was held on April 22, 2015. THIEF team from SJTU stood out from a number of teams and won the grand prize of "game development" item in Chinese region and would soon attend the World competition on behalf Chinese region. Recently, the team is actively preparing for the game, striving to march into the world final that would be held in Seattle, USA this July.

THIEF team was guided by Professor Xiao Shuangjiu from SJTU School of Software, headed by graduate student of School of Software Chen Xu, and comprised of members from School of Media and Design (undergraduate students Wei Zihan, Wang Riyue and Huang Jin. The team was formed in September 2014 and has won great support from the university ever since. The team has cooperated and worked very well and forged theirway through preliminaries and semi-finals to the finals, standing out from more than 1,000 teams in China. In the finals held in Beijing, the team won the unanimous endorsement of the judges by their excellent product demonstrations and the wonderful reply to the Panel. Competing with strong teams like Adoor from Peking University and PuzzleWave from South China Agricultural University, THIEF from SJTU finally won the fierce competition and obtained the grand prize of "Microsoft Imagine Cup" in the Chinese region.

What THIEF developed is a 3D puzzle game using two engines: Unity and Cocos. The experts said that this game is very mature in the overall planning, technology utilization, music and art production, players experience and other aspects. It is reported that a month before the Chinese regional final, the game had already been uploaded on two foreign professional gaming sites and was downloaded by a large number of players. The game also won the "Best Application of the Week". Lou Chi, the judge and chief editor of Tencent Science and Technology said that he saw more and more Chinese young people starting thinking about innovation and entrepreneurship, and their courage to practice and pioneer. He also think that Microsoft "Imagine Cup" competition has not only inspired the  young Students' enthusiasm for innovation, but also provided professional guidance and advice for them, helping them to find a good linkage between their hobby and market.

Microsoft "Imagine Cup" Global Student Competition is the world's largest and most influential student science and technology competition. Founded in 2003, it is aimed to encourage young students imagination and creativity, encouraging them to join in the technological innovation. Globally, over 160,000 students from more than 190 countries and territories participated in the competition. This competition has also won UNESCO's support. The participating students can unleash their creativity and technical skills on this platform and create a first-class technology solutions in the latest technology platform. Their idea would be transformed into commercial reality and in this way students' innovative spirit and social responsibility would be cultivated.

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Recall Father of China’s Rare Earth, Alumnus of SJTU Academician Xu Guangxian
item.description:
In the morning of April 28, 2015, Xu Guangxian, academician of Chinese Academy of Sciences, winner of State Highest Science and Technology Prize in 2008, Father of China Rare Earth, the class of 1944 alumnus of Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU), winner of SJTU Lifetime Achievement Award for Outstanding Alumni, passed away. During his lifetime, Xu Guangxian was concerned about the development of SJTU and SJTUers. He thanked SJTU for providing solid foundation for his life and his career. In SJTU, we also have a Gunagxian Road to show our deep friendship to him.

Xu Guangxian's family was middle class. His father opened a cloth store with others, thus his family was well-off. But after his second elder brother lost 8000 yinyuan (yinyuan is an ancient currency unit) in a gambling, his family became poor. Yet his mother told them, "you need to study hard and learn an expertise. Stop relying on our family." after that, Xu Guangxian kept his mother's words in his mind and started learning.

He graduated from the primary school with distinction. To find a job as early as possible, he just read a year in the high school and then transferred to the construction department of Zhejiang University, attached Hangzhou Advanced Industrial Vocational School with a second position. He recalled, "a year later, after Hangzhou fell into enemy hands, I went to Ningbo advanced industrial school together with the school and graduated in 1939. At that time, Xukun Railway Construction Engineering Bureau came to Ningbo to recruit intern engineers. 8 of our classmates were recruited. Then we were taken to Shanghai and lived in an inn. The employer told us that he would buy tickets for us, but he never came back. He run away with all our money. We were all dumb-struck. Then we drifted apart."

After this incident, Xu Guangxian came to Shanghai alone and came to find his elder brother who was teaching in middle school. He then was introduced to be a teacher. At that time, SJTU was very famous in Jiangsu and Zhejiang provinces. He admired SJTU so much that he decided to get involved in SJTU. After several months hard-work, he completed all the exercises in Big Algebra written by Hall and Knight and Analytic geometry written by Smith and Gale. In 1940, Xu Guangxian was admitted into the department of chemistry of SJTU with excellent academic performance.

Gao Xiaoxia was classmate of Xu Guangxian in SJTU and they got married for common interests. In 1946, they passed the national students abroad examination. With relatives financial support, Xu Guangxian went to America beforehand in 1948 and studied in the department of chemistry of University of Washington. The same year, Xu Guangxian ranked the first in the summer academic probation class of Columbia University in New York, and was admitted as a graduate student majoring in quantum chemistry. At the same time, he was hired as a teaching assistant, salary received from which enabled Gao Xiaoxia to come to New York University and majored in analytical chemistry. In 1949, Xu Guangxian received Master of Science degree from Columbia University; in 1951, his doctoral dissertation "Optically Active Quantum Chemical Theory" won him the doctorate degree in physical chemistry, making him the one who received his doctorate degree within the shortest time and was selected as a member of American Sigma Xi Honor Science Club. At the same time, Gao Xiaoxia was also granted the master's degree in analytical chemistry of New York University and went for further study. At that time, Columbia University wanted to engage Xu Guangxian as a lecturer or recommend him to be a postdoctor in the University of Chicago and ask him to join in American nationality. But they learned about the earthshaking changes in new China and the explosion of war to resist US aggression and aid Korea. After discussion, the couple determined to come back to China and devote themselves into the educational business of China.

Till today, "cascade extraction" is still the theoretical basis of our rare earth industry. The Chinese storm caused by Xu Guangxian brought China hundreds of millions profits. This project won the third prize of national natural science, the National Science Conference award and the award of progress of science and technology.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Tsien Hsue-Shen Original Drama Staged Successful in Xi’an
item.description:
On April 20, the opening ceremony of 2015 "Mainstay of China-Promotion Program for Science Masters among Universities", cosponsored by China Association for Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of PRC, Central Committee of the Communist Young League, Chinese Academy of Science and Chinese Academy of Engineering, was held in Xidian University. The play Tsien Hsue-Shen, directed by Shanghai Jiao Tong University and served as the first play in this program, was performed splendidly.

Chen Zhiya, the Party Secretary of Xidian University, expressed his welcome to the first performance on behalf of all faculties and students of Xidian University. Chen said that this program had brought 27 visual feasts and cultural feasts for Xi'an and Xidian University and all of them felt honored and looked forward to it.

Wang Chunfa, a member of leading party group and the Secretary of Secretariat in CAST, made a speech. Wang said that this promotion program was launched by CAST in the beginning of 2012, which aims at vigorously promote of the science masters who have made great contributions to the development of our country and enjoyed a high prestige in Tech World.

Zhu Jian, the Vice Secretary of SJTU, introduced the creation of this play. Tsien Hsue-Shen, directed by SJTU, vividly showed the patriotism and legendary life of this great scientist. 

Xidian University, as one of great universities in China, has made great contributions to the development of telecommunications in China. On the October 8, 2014 when it was the 59th anniversary to celebrate Qian's coming back home, the Experimental Class for Tsien Hsue-Shen Space Science was established in Xidian University and Qin Yonggang, the son of of Tsien Hsue-Shen, inaugurated for this launching ceremony. This program aims at cultivating the top talents in the field of space information science and space technology.

With the concerted efforts of all performers, the performance achieved a great success. There will be nine plays in this opening ceremony in Xi'an and twenty-seven plays will be performed for all young students and citizens in this ancient city in two weeks.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Children's Hospital, SJTU First Applies PPVI in China on Child with Congenital Heart Disease
item.description:
Children's Hospital, affiliated to SJTU School of Medicine has announced the successful implementation of China's first successful case of Percutaneous Pulmonary Valve Implantation (PPVI), filling the gap in China's children PPVI interventional treatment of patients with congenital heart disease.   

Over the past decade, European countries and United States have been using percutaneous pulmonary valve implantation (PPVI) in clinical practice. The application of Interventional treatment is not only an effective way to terminate a large number of pulmonary regurgitation and improve blood circulation of lung tissue and the function of right ventricular, but also avoids a second time open-chest surgery.

Preoperative angiography shows severe pulmonary valve regurgitation.

Venus-P pulmonary valved stent gradually releases.

After valved stent fully releases, pulmonary angiography shows that reflux disappears.

The thoracic surgery department and cardiology department of Shanghai Children's Medical Center has been cooperated since 2011. After a long-term experimental study, the research team led by Professor Liu Jinfen participated in the international cooperation projects of Venus-P pulmonary valved stent clinical trials. In this case, the child who accepted PPVI treatment in the hospital is 15 years old. The child was diagnosed with tetralogy of Fallot at birth and started to receive surgical treatment since sixth month. In the follow-up diagnoses over the past few years, it is found that the child started to have more severe pulmonary regurgitation, right ventricular progressive expansion and decreased capacity for action. Before the admission to hospital this time, the cardiac MRI examination revealed that the child's RV EDV Index has been up to 195ml / m², and the child's life was at stake. After carefully discussion, the medical team decided to apply PPVI treatment. With the assistance from department of heart surgery, echocardiographic, anesthesiology and nursing, Dr. Gao Wei and Dr. Liu Tingliang from Cardiology Department succeeded in applying the PPVI treatment and implanting a Venus-P valved stent. The cardiovascular angiography and echocardiography afterwards revealed that pulmonary regurgitation disappeared and the blood flowed smoothly, which indicated a satisfying result. The surgery lasted for one and a half hour and the first case proved to be a complete success. And the child has recently been healthy enough to leave the hospital.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Graduates Found Dark Matter and the Principle of "Lollipop" Science
item.description:
How long would a lollipop licking take? Is this an unconstrained idea or an arigorous scientific problem? Where is the mysterious phantom particle? How to become the"gold particle Hunter"? At noon on April 17th, Huang Jinzi and Tan Andi two outstanding graduates of Zhiyuan College were invited to deliver a lecture with lollipop and dark matter.

Huang Jinzi: a wonderful research trip triggered by a lollipop

How long would a lollipop licking take? The team that Huang Jinzi is in, a graduate of Zhiyuan College, SJTU, and now a doctoral student in the Department of mathematics in New York University found the answer in a study of solid solubility experiments. They put the lollipop in the pipeline, so that the water of different speed can flow through the pipe, then they used time-lapse camera to get its photos of dissolution process. They found that, no matter what the original shape the lollipop is and no matter how high flow velocity is, the final shape of lollipop is almost always the same when it's on the verge of dissolution. The study found the solubility of solid. Take the lollipop which is about one centimeter in diameter for example, it takes about 1000 times to lick. His study raises people's enthusiasm to be involved in scientific experiments. Huang Jinzi also won the 2015 pineapple Science Prize for mathematics.

Tan Andi: the young "dark visitor" of ghost particle

Tan Andi, a graduate of Zhiyuan College, SJTU and a doctoral student of University of Maryland once followed the Professor Ji Xiangdong, a "thousand person plan" national expert, to be engaged in the research work on particle physics experiments in China Jin Ping UndergroundLaboratory which is likely to become one of the world's best underground laboratory according to an article published on magazine Nature, specifically introducing Jinping underground laboratory work and Jinping mountain.

"Zhiyuan" effect

Zhiyuan college focuses on training of top-notch students in different direction and invite the world's top professors or teachers from various departments of SJTU to deliver lectures. The purpose is to let the students learn in different directions and have close contact with professors.

It is reported that, at present, there are 159 graduates of Zhiyuan college during the past three years, and more than 90% of the graduates go to world top university to further their studies

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Celebrats 119th Anniversary
item.description:
On April 11, the 119th anniversary of Shanghai Jiao Tong University was held grandly in the New Indoor Stadium on Minhang campus. Jiang Sixian, Chairperson of the University Council, President Zhang Jie, representatives of alumni, faculties and students joined together to celebrate this wonderful moment.

President Zhang Jie gave a keynote speech on "Committed to Innovation and Pursuing Excellence". Since the implement of reform and opening-up policy, the faculties and students of SJTU showed their burst of innovation again and SJTU has been praised as "one of the fastest growing universities since the implement of reform and opening-up policy" over the past three decades. President Zhang Jie pointed that the existence of university aims at continuously providing innovation for the society. For China, universities play a more important role and they should undertake more responsibilities. The ceremony of "Siyuan Contribution Award for Outstanding Alumni" was held on the celebration. Jiang Sixian and Zhang Jie awarded for the prize winners.  

2015 President's Award of SJTU was also held on the celebration. Jiang Sixian, the chairperson of the University Council, and President Zhang Jie awarded for the prize winners.  

On the celebration, Jiang Sixian, the chairperson of the University Council, addressed that we never suspend our teaching and learning despite of toil or difficulties over the past 119 years. He pointed that the 10th SJTU congress of party representatives was held a month ago and the overall vision of "building the world first-class university in China" was taken shape. Facing the future, SJTU will focus on cultivating top talents with sense of social responsibility, international view and innovation ability.

Jiang Sixin, on behalf of SJTU, announced the call-up of the 120th anniversary. He said that next year we would get together again in SJTU, relive our wonderful college life here, witness the achievements of our alma mater and build the bright future of her. Taking the 120th anniversary as a good opportunity, SJTU will promote comprehensive reform, accelerate its connotative development so as to present a generous gift for the 120th birthday of our alma mater.

Next Year, Shanghai Jiao Tong University will celebrate its 120th anniversary and the announcement for it was released on this celebration.

The celebration of 119th anniversary ended with singing school anthem by all attendees to remember this unforgettable moment. We are proud of our alma mater and wish that she will enjoy a brighter future.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying                  Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Prof. Fang Bing of SJTU Affiliated Ninth Hospital Elects As EHASO
item.description:
Recently, in the capital city of Tennessee-Nashville，Professor Fang Bing from Shanghai Jiao Tong University Ninth Affiliated Hospital was accepted as the member of Edward H. Angle Society of Orthodontists (EHASO). By now, there are 70 EHASO members out of U.S., in which only 2 are Chinese.

Professor Fang Bing has been working in the field of clinical surgical correction of dento - maxillofacial deformities, and has achieved both theoretical and practical achievements in this discipline. As for herself, becoming the member of EHASO is absolutely an honor, and it is also a signal of the development of SJTU Ninth Affiliated Hospital's oral and maxillofacial surgery department which has now reached the international level.

Edward Hartley Angle（June 1, 1855-August 11, 1930）is an American dentist, and also the father of modern odontoplasty. The American Society of Orthodontist was founded in 1930, and it was named EHASO after Angle's death. It now has a history of 85 years, and its newly established journal Angle Orthodontist is the seconded renowned academic journal in this field.

Brief introduction of the Professor

Professor Fang Bing is a chief physician and doctoral supervisor of Shanghai Jiao Tong University Ninth Affiliated Hospital, also the director of Orthodontics and Orthognathic Surgery Center. In the recent years, she had published more than 80 articles in journals home and abroad, in which 20 was accepted by SCI.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Delegation Witness the Launching Ceremony of Rhodes Scholarship in China
item.description:
On March 30, the dinner party for Launching Ceremony of Rhodes Scholarship in China was held in Beijing. Over 250 distinguished guests from the academia, business community, the sporting world as well as the circle of literary and art attended and witnessed it. At the invitation of Rhodes Foundation, President Zhang Jie, with the delegation of Shanghai Jiao Tong University which included alumni, professors and internal students, attended this dinner party. As a special invited guest, president Zhang took part in the topic discussion and introduced the idea of talent cultivation of SJTU to the guests.

Zhang Jie said that the core of a university's spirit lies in scientific spirit and human concern, which has much in common with the core of Rhodes Spirit. Universities hold fast to academic sprit and continuously strive for excellence while Rhodes Scholarship advocates excellence in academics, leadership, benevolence and courageous spirits, these two cores are inseparably interconnected. Shanghai Jiao Tong University, as one of the key partners of Rhodes Scholarship in China, hopes that the outstanding students in SJTU can obtain the scholarship. The students should not only be excellent in academics and characters, but also should be benevolent, courageous, honest, kind-hearted, have sense of responsibility on the world and people as well as contribute their efforts.

Rhodes Scholarship enjoys a good reputation of "Nobel Prize for Worldwide Undergraduates". The scholarship, founded by Cecil Rhodes in 1903, selects 83 top fresh graduates across the world every year and sponsored them to study for a master's degree or a doctor's degree at University of Oxford. All the scholarship winners are named "Rhodes Scholars" which is regarded as one of the highest honor among the global academic community.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying            Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Professor Wang Ruzhu Awarded 2014 Shanghai "Model Worker of the Year"
item.description:
Recently, the 2014 Shanghai "Model Workers of the Year" was announced. SJTU Professor Wang Ruzhu from School of Mechanical Engineering and other 9 model workers were awarded. "China Dream, Merit of Labor--2014 Shanghai 'Model Worker of the Year' Awards Ceremony" was held at the Radio and Television Building on March 31st. Academician Zhang Jie, President of SJTU attended the ceremony, and presented the award to Professor Wang Ruzhu.

Shanghai Model Worker Association began to recommend and award "Model Worker of the Year" since 2012. The activity carries out once a year, each year with 10 candidates being awarded. This year, altogether 47 candidates are recommended by 35 districts, counties, and council (industry) trade unions to attend this election. These candidates all have enjoyed the title of National Model Worker or Municipal Model Worker.

Professor Wang Ruzhu shared his understanding about teaching and research on the ceremony. "The most important work of a teacher is teaching. Teacher should act like a norm and use his own words and actions to affect his students influence the people around, this is a model." As a "green energy explorers," Professor Wang Ruzhu introduced his own innovations and technological achievements on new energy and environmental aspects. "What we have done is to solve the problem of winter heating in the Yangtze River region. The use of air source heat pump can help release the problem. As long as each family loaded on 3 machines, they will be able to achieve the winter heating, summer air conditioning, hot water supply throughout the year to enjoy five-star comfort. They not only can save 20%-30 % energy, they can also lower the investment and operating costs."

As a special guest, Academician Zhang Jie was invited to award the prize for Professor Wang Ruzhu. Zhang Jie said Professor Wang Ruzhu is the excellent university model who played the role of innovative engine. He fully embodies the university motto of SJTU: "When you drink water, never shall you forget its source; love your motherland and bring honor to your almamater" and reflected the core spirit of the motto "thanksgiving", "responsibility", "passion" and "dream". Professor Wang Ruzhu hopes to lead the team to take the lead and play a key role in leading efforts for the construction of Shanghai into a technological innovation center with international influence.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: 【SJTU Wisdom】 New Progress Made in Finding Biomarker Related to Migration of Breast Cancer by SJTU
item.description:
【Wisdom of SJTU】More than one hundred years, SJTUers have made lots of achievements with our intelligence and wisdom, many of which are among the best in modern and contemporary history in China. This shows the wisdom of talent cultivation, the wisdom of scientific research, the wisdom of social service and more of SJTU in contributing to China in particular and the world as a whole. The News sets the Wisdom of SJTU special column, gathering the wisdom of all SJTUers and exhibiting our new efforts for science and technology development as well as for social civilization progress.

This March, Tao Shengce's Team in Systemic Biomedical Research Institute of SJTU, collaborating with School of Biomedical Engineering of SJTU and National Institute of Birth Control, published a thesis titled "Lectin RCA-I specifically binds to metastasis-associated cell surface glycans in triple negative breast cancer" on the Breast Cancer Research. Post-doctor Zhou Shumin and doctoral student Cheng Li are both first authors of the thesis.

Breast Cancer ranks first with regard to both morbidity and mortality for women on the planet. Triple negative breast cancer, TNBC sufferers make up for 15% to 20% of all Breast cancer patients. For a lack of surface hormone receptors and marker for detection, TNBC is not sensitive to the currently used hormone therapy or the targeted therapy, and the prognosis is poor. One of the main reasons lies in the fact that it is apt to migrate. In this sense, the discovery of the related marker for the migration of TNBC is of great significance to further research into the pathogenesis, clinical test and treatment of this cancer.

This study focuses on the level of glycosylation and the differences on cell surfaces, which provides a new perspective for detecting biomarkers of other cancers.

This study was funded by 863 Program, 973 Program and National Natural Science Foundation of China.

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Student Team Wins Champion of 2015 HULT Prize of APAC Area
item.description:
Recently, the 2015 HULT Prize of APAC area was held in Shanghai Teams from 38 world-famous universities including Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Peking University, University of Cambridge, University of Pennsylvania and so on participated in the competition. Long Chunhong, Du Nan, Michael Custer, Matthias Keschka and Callum Porter-Harris from Shanghai Advanced Institute of Finance (SAIF) formed the team named "Telestory", and won the first prize of the competition. It became the first Chinese team to won the prize in this competition, and the team will participate the final competition held in New York in this autumn as the representative of the APAC area.

The HULT prize was awarded by the Times as "one of the five originalities which change the world". It was created in 2009 by the creator of EF education Bertil Hult. The prizes are awarded by former President Clinton, and the aim of the prize is to encourage students to solve big social problems of the world.

The 2015 HULT Prize selected the early education of children as the topic, aiming to provide the 10million children under six years old who live in poor area in city with high quality early education. The team of Telestory designed a mobile phone platform which could send books in the form of speech sounds, which enables illiterate parents to subscribe story books read in the local language with a pretty low cost. When the project is operated for a period of time, the cost could be significantly reduced, and their plan is to enlarge the scale of customers from 10 thousand to 1 million in three years' time.

Charlemagne Quinitio as the person in charge in of the competition in the APAC area celebrated the achievement of the team, and pointed out that although the competition had been held in Shanghai for five successive years, it was the first time that the Chinese team won the prize. He also expected more outstanding performances of Chinese teams.

The SAIF is a world first-class business school held by the Shanghai municipal government and Shanghai Jiao Tong University. The project of Master of Finance aims to cultivate professional and international talents who could make contributions to the Chinese Finance sector, as well as cultivate the sense of responsibility, leadership, communicative skills of students with all forms of SAIF LIVE and ELSA.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Two Giants Joines Hands: SJTU and Caltech in SJTU Graduate Commencement Ceremony 2015
item.description:
Have you noticed that students in blue caps and gowns are found everywhere on campus? Have you ever looked forward to the day when you are wearing those cool caps and gowns yourself ? On March 21, 2015, Shanghai Jiao Tong University held its Graduate Commencement Ceremony for this year's postgraduates and PhDs. Before the ceremony began, all those blue gowns were already waiting in the New Stadium on SJTU Minhang Campus.

Girls put on funny or adorable expressions and snapped group photos with the help of selfie-stick, while boys crowded together to chat. It was the last chance for them. Moreover, many graduate couples are catching our attention with their unique and public display of love. Loads of single "leftovers" were looking at them with envy. Graduates were happily taking photos with two pretty lamb dolls, this year's mascot. Those dolls were also in the same blue gowns and caps.

The ceremony was grandly unveiled after the warm-up dancing and singing. Zhang Jie, President of SJTU, led the familiar school leaders and walked onto the rostrum. The whole stadium burst into a warm applause. "Bro Jie" placed high hopes and great expectations of innovation on graduates in his commencement speech. Dr. Thomas Rosenbaum, President of California Institute of Technology also attended the ceremony and was awarded an honorary doctorate by Shanghai Jiao Tong University.

It was interesting to mention that when granting degrees to graduates, given the fact that there were too many graduates in the stadium, Bro Jie could only let graduates DIY by saying "please shift the tassel on your cap from right to left" to save time. Accompanied by the well-meaning laughter, graduates stood up in turns and solemnly placed their tassels.

SJTU has bid farewell to a number of excellent graduates, and sent those passionate and talented youngsters to the places where their dream started.

After the commencement ceremony, the news conference held together with Thomas Rosenbaum, President of California Institute attracted many media. Presidents of the two great universities shared their opinions on innovation. Bro Jie pointed out that, as one of the top Chinese universities, Shanghai Jiao Tong University attached great importance to the further cooperation with Caltech on innovative areas raised by NPC and CPPCC. President Thomas Rosenbaum said that the two universities would join hands in various research areas and reform the approaches to cooperation. He admitted that Chinese students were very excellent in advancing science and engineering. He believed that the two universities could draw on each other's merits for common progress, finally brought scientific research the world over to an unprecedented level.

 

 

Reported by Wang Yifan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Irish Chamber Orchestra Gave Performance in Shanghai Jiaotong University
item.description:
On the evening of March 16th, Irish melody surrounded Jingjing hall of Shanghai Jiao Tong University. Three musicians from Irish Chamber Orchestra brought a wonderful Feast of music for SJTU teachers and students. Austin Gormley, General Consul of Irish Consulate in Shanghai, Eoghan Patrick Duffy, deputy general consul of Irish Consulate in Shanghai and Hu Hao, Minister of Propaganda Department of SJTU Party Committee attended the concert.

At the beginning, Austin Gormley said hello to SJTU teachers and students in fluent Chinese, which aroused the applause. He said "I am glad to come to this well-known university. Since tomorrow is Ireland's national day, I am glad to share with you our national music." Besides he hoped that teachers and students of SJTU could enjoy the Irish wonderful music and feel the unique artistic charm of Ireland.

During the past six years, Irish Chamber Orchestra gave performance every year in Shanghai, but this is the first time they came to the Shanghai Jiao Tong University. The orchestra hoped that the concert would show the charm of traditional Irish music to Chinese college students, so as to attract more Chinese young people to visit Ireland and study music. "We are looking forward to cooperate with SJTU Symphony Orchestra, and also hope to learn from outstanding Chinese musicians as an exchange and harvest in the cultural collision."

Miss. Wang, a freshman from Antai College of Economics and Management said "today's performance is very exciting; I like the first two Irish folk music very much, which makes me feel the Irish beautiful, romantic life and culture. I hope the JingJing hall later can hold more similar activities."

As the beautiful tune lingered in the room, music which is without borders is entrusted with the universal human emotion. This night in SJTU, the audiences feel the charm of music and Irish culture together across borders.

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: 【SJTU Wisdom】 SJTU Found Propagation Law of Vibration Mechanics in Saturated Soft Soil
item.description:
The aggraded valley plain and the seabed form the unique geomorphological environment of riverside and coastal areas. However, when building high-rise buildings, bridges and some other constructions, if the moisture content is too high, the soil will form saturated soft soil. When interact with other factors like earthquake wave and traffic load, the pile foundation is very likely to become loose. Currently this difficult problem was solved by Professor Wang Jianhua of SJTU School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering. Through fifteen years, he led his team members to reveal the law of vibration mechanics in saturated soil, and the water in saturated soil, which is very destructive, is now likely to be overcome.

Piling in dry hard soil to build bridges and high-speed rail is conducive to the stability of buildings. However, the soft soil has many pores with water in them, which would decrease the stability of piling. Plus the earthquake wave and other vibrations made by traffic, this raise very high requirement of the designing and implementing of the work. Wang Jianhua introduced that Shanghai is a typical area with soft soil, which brings huge challenges to the construction of the city.

The water in the soil has huge power. As the development of the modern city, railway, bridges and high buildings are built rapidly. The living space underground is also broadened. Therefore, safe and comfortable living and commuting space becomes the topic which draws more and more attention of people. Then how does vibration spread in the saturated soil with water? How to control the vibration and make the piling stable? For many years, this has been the difficult problems which are recognized in the whole world. After fifteen years' research, the team led by Wang Jianhua finally found the law of propagation of vibration mechanics and the influence of this kind of propagation to the stability of piling. According to these, the team built a series of calculating models, which provide theoretical method for the implementing of piling in soft soil areas. As the pioneering research at home, this research finding won the first prize of 2014 Natural Science Award of the Ministry of Education, and was accepted in the Shanghai Standard of Foundation Design.

Team member of the research team mentioned that before people had any deep understanding of the law of propagation of vibration in saturated soil, they sometimes would assure the stability of buildings by adding piles, which could cause the waste of resources. If people could design the location and scale of piling according to the laws revealed by the team, they could save a respectable amount of expenditure. Currently, this finding has been used in Hongqiao Integrated Transportation Hub, Shanghai West Railway Station, and Shanghai International Finance Center, which saved more than 100 million RMB.

Compared with riverside and coastal areas, the ocean environment is even more complex. In the past several years, marine economy has become the important part of our domestic economy. With the exploitation of marine resources from shallow water to deep sea, from near sea to international sea area, if the ports, ocean platforms and under-sea pipes could withstand the vibration of ocean currents and seaquakes has become the indispensable factor of the development of marine resources and the safeguard of resources and energy.

"The soil in the bottom of the sea is saturated with water, and seaquakes and earthquakes in the bottom of sea occur very often. So compared with the land, the ocean environment is more complex. Piles and pipes in the sea should overcome many challenges like the saturated soil and wave earthquakes, and in this situation, the stability of ocean engineering is the top questions that we need to consider when exploiting marine resources." Wang Jianhua said that in addition to the construction on the land, this research finding also can be applied to the marine projects. In the meantime, the team has already begun the research of ocean foundation, and won one key project of National Natural Science Fund, and three supporting projects of National Natural Science Fund. It is believed that before long, the ocean engineering would be more stable and become the supporting point of development of marine economy and marine resources' utilization.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTUers Succeed in Debut of 36th Odyssey of Mind China Final
item.description:
The 36th International Odyssey of the Mind China Final and the 28th China Odyssey of the Mind Tournament ("OM") was held on March 7th, 2015 in Shanghai. This year, OM China final was a grand scale, including 520 teams coming from 14 provinces, autonomous regions, such as Shanghai, Beijing, Shandong etc., and Germany. 38 teams were college students, the scale of which was the largest in history. These college students came from 17 universities, like Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU), Tongji University and Shanghai University of Science and Technology. 5 undergraduate students representing SJTU attended the tournament and won the second prize.

In the long-term part, 5 SJTU students plotted a story based on the contest problem "experiencing technical difficulties" to show people's experiences in handling various technical problems in the future and to show concerns about the technical traps that we might encounter in the future. As to the techniques, 5 students took fully advantages of their majors by employing a series of ordinary materials, such as slide rail, CDs, photoresistance, KT board and rubber band etc., to make props, like scaffold whose lift control could be operated manually. In the off-the-cuff question part, students designed solutions to save the princess. They came up with lots of wonderful and amazing solutions, for example, they made Ma Liang with the magic paint brush to draw a road to the heaven; they enabled the sea to rise to the height leveling to the castle windowsill; they made the princess lie so that her nose could be long enough to be used as a brace. In the contest, 5 SJTU students fully employed their professional expertise, answered the questions creatively with good teamwork, and were highly praise by the judges.

OM aimed at exploring the teenagers' creativity and cultivating two kinds of spirits: spirit of creativity, encouraging being different; spirit of teamwork, encouraging working together in joint effort.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: 【SJTU Wisdom】SJTU Research Spurs Microbial Pharmaceutical Industry Upgrade
item.description:
【Wisdom of SJTU】More than one hundred years, SJTUers have made lots of achievements with our intelligence and wisdom, many of which are among the best in modern and contemporary history in China. This shows the wisdom of talent cultivation, the wisdom of scientific research, the wisdom of social service and more of SJTU in contributing to China in particular and the world as a whole. The News sets the Wisdom of SJTU special column, gathering the wisdom of all SJTUers and exhibiting our new efforts for science and technology development as well as for social civilization progress.

Recently, the authoritative international journal of metabolic engineering - Metabolic Engineering has just published a latest research paper entitled "Engineering validamycin production by tandem deletion of γ-butyrolactone receptor genes in Streptomyces hygroscopicus 5008" done by the doctoral student Tan Gaoyi of School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology under the co-guidance of Zhong Jianjiang and Bai Linquan (Gao-Yi Tan, Yao Peng, Chenyang Lu, Linquan Bai*, Jian-Jiang Zhong* (2015). Engineering validamycin production by tandem deletion of γ-butyrolactone receptor genes in Streptomyces hygroscopicus 5008. Metabolic Engineering 28: 74-81. DOI: 10.1016/j.ymben.2014.12.003).

Validamycin is a kind of agricultural antibiotic produced by Streptomyces hygroscopicus var. jinggangensis. It is efficient and nontoxic, environmental friendly with low fungi resistance, which makes it one of the most important biopesticides in preventing and controlling rice sheath blight diseases. Currently, the annual output of validamycin is between 5 to 7 million tons in China, with wide application scope and large market potential.

Professor Zhong Jianjiang has cooperated closely with Professor Deng Zixin's group ever since 2006. They have revealed the regulatory mechanism of γ-butyrolactone (GBL) in validamycin biosynthesis, and interpreted how exogenous 1,4-butyrolactone stimulates A-factor-like cascade for the first time. The work provided a new possibility for achieving a high antibiotic yield by engineering the bacterium, and also showed a simple but effective fermentation strategy (Gao-Yi Tan, Linquan Bai*, Jian-Jiang Zhong* (2013). Exogenous 1,4-butyrolactone stimulates A-factor-like cascade and validamycin biosynthesis in Streptomyces hygroscopicus 5008. Biotechnology and Bioengineering 110(11): 2984-93. DOI: 10.1002/bit.24965).

The team has found that among the known actinomycetes' whole genomes, about 1/3 of the streptomycete genomes including that of Streptomyces hygroscopicus 5008 have multiple sets of afsA-arpA homologues in GBL regulatory system, with an obvious difference from its classic system.
