With in-depth study, this research team elucidated the regulatory mechanism of several sets of afsA-arpA homologues in validamycin biosynthesis, and upgraded the metabolic engineering of validamycin on the basis of the discovery. For the industrial strain, the yield of validamycin is improved from 19 g/L to 24 g/L while the fermentation productivity is enhanced to 9.7 g/(L d) from 6.7 g/(L d), both of which are the highest as ever reported.

The strategy proposed by the research enables to improve the yield of validamycin remarkably and can also guide the metabolic improvement of actinomycetes with several sets of GBL regulatory system. The work is expected to spur the microbial pharmaceutical industry upgrading.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Vice President of Oxford Attended International Science & Technology Forum at SJTU
item.description:
On the afternoon of February 27th, the fourth International Science & Technology Forum was held in the multifunctional hall on the ninth floor of Library & Information Tower at SJTU. Professor Ian Walmsley, Pro-Vice-Chancellor of University of Oxford (Shorted as Oxford), was invited to make a keynote speech at the forum. Peng Yinghong, assistant to the president, made the welcome speech.

Professor Walmsley introduced the overall situation of the scientific research at Oxford. As one of the oldest universities in the world, Oxford had cultivated 26 British prime ministers, more than 50 Nobel Prize winners and numerous outstanding scientific research personnel. According to the latest evaluation of Research Excellence Framework carried out by the British government, Oxford was ranked first among all universities in Britain, with nearly half of its research achievements rated as "world-leading". Such an honor could be credited with the university's superiority in disciplines such as clinical medicine, life sciences, mathematics, physics, social sciences and humanities as well as its global strategic objectives-unremitting efforts in establishing extensive cooperation across disciplines around the world.

Professors from School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology and School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering at SJTU introduced respectively their cooperation with Oxford and other organizations in Britain. Besides, Professor Walmsley discussed with the research management personnel at SJTU about other issues, such as joint symposiums, mutual participation in "Newton Research Collaboration Program" and a "3+1+X" degree training program co-propelled by Oxford and School of Materials Science and Engineering at SJTU.

Professor Ian Walmsley is a renowned scholar in the field of ultrafast photon and quantum optics, and he was elected to Royal Society in 2012. In addition, he is also a member of the Optical Society, the American Physical Society and the Institute of Physics.Since 2009, he had served as Pro-Vice-Chancellor of Oxford who had been in charge of scientific research.

This forum was presided over by Feng Yan, Deputy Director of Office of Research Management, which was the organizer of the forum. Besides, associate deans for research of over twenty schools and professors in related fields attended the conference.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Tai Chong Cheang Group Signed to Fund SJTU Endowed Chair Professor Projects
item.description:
In the afternoon of March 6th, the signing ceremony of "Tai Chong Cheang Endowed Chair Professor Project" and the awarded student forum of "Zhang Mingwei" full scholarships were held in the conference room of SJTU Law School in Xuhui Campus. Mr. Gu Jiangang, chairman of Tai Chong Cheang Group and representative of "Zhang Mingwei" Charity Fund, Mr. Zhang Zhongyan, representative of "Zhang Mingwei" Charity Fund, Mr. Lu Yongzhi, general manager of Tai Chong Cheang Vessels (Shanghai) Co., Ltd., and Mr. Li Xiang, office manager of Tai Chong Cheang Group had attended the ceremony. Party Secretary of SJTU, Professor Jiang Sixian extended warm reception to them and discussed the promising cooperation between the group and SJTU in fields such as logistics and shipping. President Zhang Jie and Mr. Gu signed the agreement on behalf of two sides.

President Zhang Jie reviewed in detail the support from Mr. Gu Jiangang and Mr.Zhang Mingwei and his family to SJTU.

Mr. Gu spoke highly of the development achievements of SJTU and expected the university to became a world-class college.

The establishment of "Tai Chong Cheang Endowed Chair Professor Project" will help SJTU to introduce more high-caliber talents in the fields of logistics and shipping, and strengthen scientific researches in related fields. Guests from the group, Vice President Zhangan Sheng, former president and honorary advisor of "Gu Guohua" Charitable Fund Xie Shengwu, Secretary-General of School Education Development Foundation Ma Lei, Deputy director of the Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan Affairs Office of SJTU Yao Yi, Dean of CY Tung Maritime and Logistics Research Institute Zhu Daoli all attended the event and witnessed the agreement signing.

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Dr. Shang Biwu was Elected as Fellow of USA National Humanities Center.
item.description:
Recently, Dr. Shang Biwu, Shanghai Jiaotong University research fellow, was elected as Fellow of USA National Humanities Center. He will be invited to the center of academic research for a year.

American National Humanities Center, founded in 1978, is an independent American research center committed to high-end research in all fields of the humanities. It is one of the world's most influential humanities and social science research institutions. Each year the center selects about 30 outstanding scholars all over the world, granting them the fellowship qualification. It is reported that there were 547 applicants with 32 fellows elected in the end. Dr. Shang Biwu was the first SJTUer elected as USA National Humanities Center Fellow and he is one of the youngest scholars so far.

Dr. Shang Biwu's being elected as America National Humanities Center Fellow, fully reflects the highly international academic recognition of SJTU in field of humanities and social sciences research. It will further promote the international academic exchanges in foreign languages and literature research.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Both SJTU Symphony Orchestra and Choir Won First in Nationwide Art Festival
item.description:
The fourth national art festival of college students which lasted six days ended in Tianjin. Shanghai Jiaotong University student orchestra and choir both won first prize in the national contest. As one of the outstanding units of nine universities in public art education, Zhu Jian, vice president of SJTU, Party Secretary and Director of Arts Education Committee attended the National School Art Education Conference held by Ministry of Education on March 2 in Tianjin.

The nationwide art festival for college students held every three years is currently the country's highest, largest and most influential college art event. "My Chinese Dream" serving as the theme of the Fourth National Students' art festival presents three notable features. First, the festival is oriented by socialist core values and students' benefits from the coverage of activities are continuously expanding. Second, the content and form of exhibitions and activities continue to get rich and innovative. The game has now formed three stages from school activities, performances organized by provincial organization to the national focus performances. The three-phase model ensures orderly activity specification. Third, through the organization of content-rich artistic practice, every student has the opportunity to attend at least one art activities. On this basis, the provinces and autonomous regions in general education administrative departments organized artistic performances focused performances, works of art shows and art education and other papers report exchange exhibition, so as to constantly improve expressive works of art.

Shanghai Jiaotong University student orchestra has participated in arts performances consecutively during past four years and all won first prize; Shanghai Jiaotong University student choir has won three first prize, a second prize. Art Troupe of Shanghai Jiaotong University has earned 11 prizes so far, making it top medal ranking among the universities in China.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Teachers and Students Staying at SJTU Celebrated the Chinese New Year of Goat
item.description:
On the evening of February 16, First Canteen and the Moslem Restaurant on the Minhang Campus of Shanghai Jiao Tong University gathered a lively group. Deputy Secretary of Shanghai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China of Health Education; Deputy Director of Shanghai Municipal Education Commission Gao Deyi; SJTU Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian; President Zhang Jie and University leaderships, teaching staffs of various departments and schools had New Year's Eve dinner together with more than 400 students staying at school during vacation, celebrating the Spring Festival. This year, SJTU, sticking to the two key words, "Warm and Love", prepared the New Year's Eve dinner in warm atmosphere and specially invited the parents of 7 students staying at school for reunion.

Gao Deyi delivered the greetings and blessings of New Year to all the teachers and students staying at school.

Jiang Sixian, representing SJTU and all teaching staffs, also delivered his blessings to all the students. He said, although students cannot reunite with their family, it can also be considered a special reunion to celebrate the Spring Festival with so many good teachers and helpful friends in SJTU.

Zhang Jie made an ardent toast. He said, the big family of SJTU would surely make students feel at home though they can't celebrate the Festival at their home.

The singing and dancing won a burst of applause. String Quartet, Voice of SJTU, a joint performance of the flute and calligraphy brought the party to new climax from time to time.

SJTU Food Service Center prepared appetizing New Year's Eve dinner. The specially design menu integrated traditional Chinese culture with SJTU elements; Liu Luanhong, a member of the board of trustees of SJTU, and his wife donated 30,000 RMB for the New Year's Eve dinner gifts. Students could draw a lottery from these gifts, which also reflected the feature of the traditional culture, enhancing the festival atmosphere.

Every year, about 300 students cannot make it home for long distance or scientific research or internship. Together with Spring Airline, SJTU carried out "Decade in Spring, Miles to SJTU" activity, to take parents to STJU during the Spring Festival. Spring Airlines provided the parents a round-ticket to Shanghai, and SJTU offered the parents dormitory and living goods so that the parents could come to Shanghai to company their children for the New Year. This year, 13 parents of 7 students came to SJTU for reunion.

 

Translated by Ling Jie    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Cao Peng and Liang Qin Won the Award of “2014 Shanghai Education News Figure of the Year”
item.description:
On the evening of Feb 9, "Education Becomes More Valuable Because Of You"-also the awarding ceremony of 2014 Shanghai Education News Figure of the Year was held by Shanghai Education Television Station, and 10 News Figures were awarded the prize. Shanghai Jiao Tong University has two candidates being awarded-Cao Peng, who was 90 years old, as the art director and chief conductor of SJTU Symphony Orchestra and art director of Shanghai Student Symphony Orchestra still proceeded music elementary education positively; and student instructor Liang Qin, who insisted on educating students with love and wrote down "Chicken Soup for Soul" of more than 200,000 words for student.

As the most influential brand activity in the field of education in Shanghai, the annual activity with its history of more than ten years has selected a batch of characteristic news figures, which brought positive social influences.

Professor Cao Peng was the conductor of SJTU Staff Indoor Orchestra since 1981; in 1986, the orchestra was renamed as Shanghai University Student Symphony Orchestra, and Cao become the art director and chief conductor. Thereafter, Cao would instruct student every week, and served as the conductor of New Year Concert for SJTU for many years. In the guidance of Cao, SJTU Student Symphony Orchestra had achieved many successes. They often went abroad to exchange and perform, and won many awards. Thus, they publicized SJTU and even the Chinese higher education with a "world name card" of symphony.

Liang Qin was called as "mother" by students of SJTU School of Medicine. Liang accompanied the students in their process of growing up and showed the utmost solicitude. Besides, Liang persisted the writing of weekly diary of more than 200,000 words, in which Liang meditated on the medical system, encouraged students and so on. These works not only moved students, but also attracted wide attention of society. In 2014, "Liberation Daily" "China Youth Daily" "Youth Daily"all reported on the story of Liang.

 

Translated by Xu Pan    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: American Cell Press Awarded SJTU “Chinese Institute of the Year 2014”
item.description:
Recently, Cell Press announced "Chinese Institute of the year 2014" for the first time. China Science Daily reviewed the poll as a third party . This poll invited some of the peer reviewers of Cell Press and well-known experts in life science home and abroad to choose the article of the year from articles collected in the "Special Edition of Chinese Scientist and Cell Press in 2014" of Science News Biweekly. Meanwhile, the poll selected the "Chinese Institute of the Year 2014" based on the numbers of published papers collected in the"Special Edition" and the international influence of corresponding journals. Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU) won "the Institute of the Year 2014".

At present, Cell Press, established in 1986, has altogether 30 journals in the field of life science. Most of these academic journals enjoy high international reputation, eapecially Cell . Cell, launched in 1974, enjoying equal popularity with Nature and Science, is considered one of the most authoritative journals in the field of life science.

PS. American Cell Press "Chinese Institute of the Year 2014"

1.      Shanghai Institues for Biological Sciences, CAS

2.      Peking University

3.      Tsinghua University

4.      Shanghai Jiao Tong University

5.      National Institute of Biological Sciences, Beijing

 



Translated by Ling Jie   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Junichi Hamada Received Honorary Doctor's Degree of SJTU
item.description:
Junichi Hamada, president of the university of Tokyo received honorary doctor's degree of SJTU. The award ceremony was held at Xuhui Campus in the afternoon of Feb.7. Junichi Hamada, president of university of Tokyo, Jiang Sixian, Chairperson of the University Council, Zhang Jie, President of SJTU attended the ceremony which was hosted by Xu Xuemin, Vice President of SJTU.

Zhang Jie said in his speech that the University of Tokyo and Shanghai Jiaotong University signed a comprehensive strategic cooperation agreement in 2011. The two sides has carried out exchanges and cooperation in multi-level and multi-disciplinary fields. The honorary doctorate of SJTU awarded to Junichi Hamada is bound to lay a good foundation for the leapfrog development of cooperation between the two universities. Zhang Jie said that president Junichi Hamada is a remarkable legal experts and higher education administrators. He has served as president of the University of Tokyo since 2009 and has brought a new management system, school governance style and way of thinking with full new vitality. Zhang Jie hoped president Junichi Hamada would help Shanghai Jiaotong University quickly emerge into the column of a world-class university with his world-class university experience.

On behalf of SJTU, Xu Xuemin read the " notice to grant an honorary doctorate on Junichi Hamada agreed by Degrees Committee of SJTU ". Zhang Jie awarded the honorary doctorate to Junichi Hamada and expressed thanks for the efforts and contributions made by Junichi Hamada to promote cooperation between the two universities.

Junichi Hamada made a brilliant speech and expressed gratitude for receiving the honorary doctorate from Shanghai Jiaotong University. He expected a further cooperation between Shanghai Jiaotong University and University of Tokyo.

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: The Leaders of SJTU Visited Our Alumni in Beijing
item.description:
At the beginning of the New Year, Jiang Sixian, Chairperson of the University Council, Zhang Jie, the president of SJTU and Zhang Ansheng, the vice president of SJTU visited our outstanding alumni in Beijing, such as Wu Wenjun, Wang Xiji, Xu Guangx ian, Gu Songfen, Chen Jingxiong and so on. They, on behalf of all SJTU faculties and students, extended to our alumni their loftiest respect and best wishes for the coming New Spring Festival. Adhering to the college motto of SJTU, the alumni had made great contributions to the development of our country and society and set a good example to all SJTU people.

In the home of Wu, Wenjun, Jiang Sixian, on behalf of all SJTU faculties and students, extended to him his best wishes for the New Year. He recalled Professor Hu Dunfu, Qiu Weiyu and Wu Chonglin who are the most influential professors in his college life. Thanks to the teaching of them, he was interested in mathematics and devoted all his life to mathematical researches.

In the home of Wang Xiji, Wang said he was very glad for the achievements we have made over the past years and he hoped that he could have further cooperation with Alma Mater in researches. He always cares about Alma Mater's development in aerospace field.

In the home of Gu Songfen, Gu and President Zhang recalled the glorious achievement made by Qian Xuesen and Fan Xuji. As outstanding Alumni, they had devoted all their lives to our "Chinese Dream" in aerospace field.

In addition, Zhang Jie paid a special visit to Xu Guangxian who were in hospital and asked the details of his situation. On behalf of all faculties and students of SJTU, President Zhang expressed his concern for his health and wished him a soon recovery.

In the home of Chen Jingxiong, Chen, together with vice president Zhang Ansheng, recalled his college life in SJTU. He said that it was the valuable cultivation in SJTU that had laid a solid foundation for his work, which would be the precious wealth in his life.

Related chiefs and officials from Party Committee Office, President Office, Alumni Association, School of Aeronautics and Astronautics, SJTU joined in this visiting.

 

 

 

Translated by Li Ying                     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: “SJTU Special Issue” Published on Advanced Materials
item.description:
In recent years, SJTU has made remarkable achievements in the research of preparation of new materials, materials chemistry and physics and application of materials, which have drawn extensive attention of counterparts at home and abroad. Invited by Doctor , editor-in-chief of Advanced Materials, SJTU researchers have written 12 papers, which have been published in a special issue in January.

The special issue gave a brief introduction to the latest research progress in field of materials in a couple of schools of SJTU, including School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, School of Materials Science and Engineering, Institute of Micro-Nano Science and Technology and Department of Physics and Astronomy. In particular, the special issue collected 6 research review papers regarding two-dimensional soft materials, bionic thermal materials, morphology genetic materials and functional composite materials, silica mineralized materials, supramolecular polymeric materials and materials used for Lithium-ion battery electrode respectively. Besides, it included 5 research letters concerning core-shell-structured polymeric nano-composites, high efficiency nano-structured silicon solar cells, micro- structured or nano-structured photoelectrode, sulphur-based composite cathode material for high-energy rechargeable lithium batteries and core-shell magnetic silica Nano-composites for bio-imaging, etc.

Advanced Materials is one of the top journals in the field of materials science, a collection of high-end and cutting-edge papers in the related domain, which earns the journal one of the highest citation rates in the area of materials science.

If interested, you can click the link http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/adma.v27.3/issuetoc to download papers in the special issue.

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU Students Won the Award of “National Self-Improvement Star” of 2014
item.description:
The results of “National Self-Improvement Star” of 2014 has been revealed recently, and SJTU student Fang Sidun from School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering won the award of “National Self-Improvement Star,” Zhang Xingchao from School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering, Yu Jie from School of International and Public Affairs won the nomination of the award of “National Self-Improvement Star.”

 

Fang Sidun: Be an Explorer on the road of Scientific Research and Contribution

Fang Sidun is a doctoral candidate of School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering. He determines to make great triumph in the field of electrical system, and thus, most of his time is spent in the library and self-study room. Hard work pays off. In July 2014, he was invited by IEEE to attend its annual meeting and give an oral report about his research. Apart from that, he also takes part in the program of “973”, which is in a steady progress now. he always believes that on the road of scientific research and contribution there must be many hardships, and only those who are brave enough could climb to the glorious top.

 

Zhang Xingchao: Choice Makes the Youth More Sublime

Zhang Xingchao is a graduate of School of Naval Architecture, Ocean and Civil Engineering. “Go to the West, go to where the country needs you most.” The first time Zhang Xingchao saw this sentence, he was deeply moved, and finally he chose to take part in the “University Student West Program.” In the West, he gave up the post which was comparatively comfortable, and applied to go to the village in the pasturing area. He overcame a series of obstacles and contributed to the villagers. While at the same time, he did not forget his study, and keep writing in the spare time. He endeavors to broad his own life as well as make contribution to the society. His choice makes his youth more sublime.

 Yu Jie: Engrave the Support and Embrace the Dream

Yu Jie is a student from the School of International and Public Affairs. He comes from an unprivileged country family, and he said that “if not for the support from the nation and the university, I might not be able to step in SJTU.” The study life in SJTU is for him also the life full of gratitude. He works hard and keeps high scores; makes full use of chances to support himself; and takes part in volunteering programs periodically. When graduated after four years, he went to Yunnan and began the one-year experience of teaching.

 The 2014 “Looking for National Self-Improvement Star” program aims to find the role model of university students who are self-reliant and positive to achieve their goals. This year’s selection was inaugurated in the September of 2014 and through the review of the specialist committee, finally they selected out 10 “National Self-Improvement Star Models”, 100 “National Self-Improvement Stars”, and 800 Nomination Awards of “National Self-Improvement Star.”

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Big Data Engineering Technology Research Center Established in SJTU
item.description:
January 19, The inauguration of Big Data Engineering Technology Research Center was held at School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering in SJTU on January 19th. The experts, scholars and industry elites who have been exploring the frontiers of data science have gathered together to talk about the current situation, the hot big data opportunities and challenge. Academician Mei Hong, Vice President of SJTU and Academician of Chinese Academy of Sciences has delivered a speech at the inaugural ceremony, Distinguished Prof. Qiu Caiming, Director of this big data research center was invited to make the keynote report. Experts from National Grid, China Unicom, Huawei, Tongji University, Shanghai Meteorological Bureau and the Environmental Monitoring Center also made keynote speeches in related fields and had discussions. The establishment of the Big Data Engineering Technology Research Center of SJTU's School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering is aimed at building world's first-class research base for big data theory and its application, in a move also to raise the top think tank of big data industry and promote the rapid development of large data industry.

The Center will make full use of SJTU's interdisciplinary, cross-industry platform to carry out basic theoretical and applied research projects as well as build a research base for big date industry that enjoys international influence. Currently, there are five research teams in the center and their research directions are basic theory of big data, smart grid applications of big data, big data remote sensing applications, big data communications and network applications, and big data location services, led respectively by Professor Qiu Caiming, Professor Jin Zhijian, Professor Yu Wenxian, Professor Jin Yaohui and Professor Yang Genke.

The team of basic theory of big data studies the problem brought by specific demand, responsible for overcoming the key technological obstacles and promoting the theoretical advance of big data theory. Distributed big data technology can provide support for grid optimization, distributed generation forecasting and user-side load forecasting, thus realizing the advanced applications in the field of intelligent scheduling and ensuring the stability, economic and efficient operation of grid. The establishment of a new massive remote sensing architecture of data acquisition, storage and analysis has greatly promoted the development of science and technology of remote sensing. The analysis of large dimensions of new wireless transmission signals is conducive to the design of the next generation 5G system. The analysis and prediction of group behavior based on the big data of location has enhanced the level of social location services, optimized government planning, and provided smart support for disaster preparedness and emergency response.

 

Translated by Zong Xufan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: World-Famous Economist Paul R. Krugman Lectured at Master Forum of SAIF
item.description:
On Jan 24, the "Master Forum" organized by Shanghai Advanced Institution of Finance (SAIF), China Academy of Financial Research (CAFR), and Chinese Society of Finance was held in the Wenzhi Hall of Shanghai Jiao Tong University. World-famous economist Paul Krugman, also professor of Princeton University, winner of the 2008 Nobel Economics Prize, delivered a lecture titled "The New Pattern of World Economy and the Opportunities and Challenges of China".

Krugman is one of the most famous economists and trade theorists currently in the world, and also a diligent columnist. He was delicately related to SJTU, since he gave a lecture in SJTU Wenzhi Hall as early as in 2009 on his first visit to China, and was invited to be the honorable professor of SJTU. This time was his first time to China Mainland after six years, and also the only lecture in China during his tour to Asia.

Before the lecture, Executive President of SAIF Professor Zhang Chun, Vice President of SAIF Professor Chen Hong, Vice President of SAIF Professor Qian Jun and so on welcomed Krugman on the third floor of SAIF and they had an intimate conversation.

Krugman in the keynote speech pointed out that currently the global economy is in an extremely stagnant situation and its duration was not predicted by many people including him. "In 2008 out economy was trapped into a dilemma, and now six years have passed, we still have not solved this problem yet, and the world economy even goes into the second turn weakness." Krugman said that some people will ask that whether the Europe will have a long-term deflation as Japan. For him, the question should be, whether Europe could avoid deflation. The reason is that if Europe goes into deflation, it will be hard for Europe to get rid of deflation. As to the American economy, Krugman said that it took a long time for America to recover its economy, and now the economy is developing with a fast speed. Krugman also pointed out that China has a good record of economic increase, but in the future China should encourage the increase of sustainable consumption. Looking forward, Krugman said that even if the progress of global economy becomes slow, we still could retain an optimistic attitude for many reasons. Now the world has grasped the modern technology, and we could go on boost the development of economy with technology.

After the keynote speech, Krugman had a deep talk with guests attended. Apart from that, he also answered the question raised by audience patiently. To express gratitude, Executive President of SAIF Professor Zhang Chun, on behalf of the academy gave a roll painting with the old Shanghai as its theme to Krugman for his coming and excellent speech.

Since its foundation, SAIF tries its best to provide the integral and international financial and administrative courses, as well as invites world famous experts and scholars home and abroad to give a forecast of world economy with professional perspectives, thus, to provide students, alumina and economy enthusiasts a high-end platform to learn and exchange. Speaker to the SAIF•CAFR Master Forum include the winner of 2011 Nobel Economics Prize Professor Christopher Simsm, the winner of 2003 Nobel Economics Prize Professor Robert F. Engle and so on.

 

Translated by Xu Pan     Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Lin Xiaoxi from Ninth People’s Hospital Won First Shu-Lan Medical Youth Prize
item.description:
On January 18, 2015, the awards ceremony of the first Shu-Lan Medicine Award, sponsored by the Academician Shusen-Lanjuan Talent Fund (Shu-Lan Foundation), was held in Taizhou, Jiangsu Province. Twelve domestic medical elites won Shu-Lan Medicine Prize and Shu-Lan Medicine Youth Prize respectively. Lin Xiaoxi, from the Plastic Surgery of Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine won the Shu-Lan Medicine Youth Prize. In Shanghai, only two doctors who are from Surgery Clinical of Huashan Hospital and Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital won this honor.

Chen Zhu, Academician of Chinese Academy of Science, Vice Chairman of the National People's Congress, Chairman of Chinese Peasants and Workers Domestic Party, Chairman of Chinese Medical Association and Sang Weiguo, academician of Chinese Academy of Engineering, Vice Chairman of 11th National People's Congress, Chairman of Chinese Pharmaceutical Association as well as Fan Daiming, Vice Dean of Chinese Academy of Engineering, attended the ceremony.  

Lin Xiaoxi is the chief physician and doctorial advisor from Plastic Surgery ofShanghai Ninth People's Hospital as well as leading experts in the fields of hemangioma, vascular malformation and medical cosmetology. Now, Lin has been appointed as the team leader of Plastic Surgery Branch and Medical Cosmetology Branch of Chinese Medical Association, chairman of Medical Cosmetology Branch of Shanghai Medical Association and vice chairman of minimally invasive Plastic andAesthetic Surgery Branch of Chinese Association of Plastic and Aesthetic.

Shu-Lan Foundation was established by two academicians Zheng Shusen and Li Lanjun in 2012, together with people of all circles. Shu-Lan Foundation set up Shu-Lan Medical Prize and Shu-Lan Medical Youth Prize to reward the elitists in the domestic medical field. The candidates are the outstanding medical scientists and technicians with Chinese Nationality (including those from Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan) who have made an original innovation and breakthrough proven to be scientific and effective by practices. The Bonus of Shu-Lan Medical Prize and Shu-Lan Medical Youth Prize are respectively 500 thousand RMB and 50 thousand RMB.

 

Translated by Li Ying   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: The MBA Program of CEIBS and ANTAI, SJTU Rank Top 100 Globally by Financial Times
item.description:
On January 26, 2015, the British Financial Times announced the 2015 top 100 global MBA rankings, the MBA program of China Europe International Business School and Antai College of Economics and Management, SJTU are listed as top 11 and 55. The MBA program of CEIBS ranks first in Asia and the MBA program of Antai College of Economics and Management ranks first in China with the highest salary growth rate of 160% and highest employment rate of 100%. Its global strength and international reputation are once again been recognized by authority.

Facing increasingly fierce competition for talents and recruitment efforts, CEIBS adjusts the course content so as to provide more employment guidance and support with focus on internationalization for graduates. Since 2014, entrepreneurship orientation and one-year MBA program have been added in CEIBS MBA program with integration of leadership modules.

Meanwhile, a number of reform and innovation are launched in Antai College of Economics and Management MBA program in recent years, leading the development of the national MBA. For example, in 2008, Antai launched the interview in advance of enrollment reform. Previously, the global rankings of EMBA and master of management programs are announced in September and October 2014. The master of management program of Antai ranks as world's top 44 projects. It is top 50 for six consecutive years. EMBA program of Antai ranked top 17 globally and top 1 domestically. Thus, Antai becomes the only Chinese business school whose three core projects rank global top 100 in two consecutive years.

The Global MBA program rankings by Financial Times began in 1999, and it is the oldest, most prestigious and one of the most respected rankings in the field of international business education.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Future Media Network Collaborative Innovation Center Council Meeting Held SJTU
item.description:
On January 18th, Future Media Network Collaborative Innovation Center Council Meeting was held in SJTU. Academician Mei Hong, Vice President and President of the Center, Professor Zhang Wenjun, Director of the Center, Academician Gao Wen, chief scientist of the Center, as well as council members and professionals from Peking University, the State Press and Publication Administration of Radio Planning Institute, Guangzhou Research Institute, CCTV, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences Institute of Acoustics, national Engineering Research Center, Shanghai TV, Huawei and Baidu all attended the meeting. The meeting was chaired by Academician Mei Hong.

At the meeting, Professor Zhang Wenjun reported to the Council the progress of the center since 2014. Since its official approval by the Ministry of Education, the Center further clarified its mission, taking building an intelligent media convergence demonstration network that can satisfy the needs of millions of households as a major task. On this basis, the Center focused efforts on the compiling work of The Four-Year Development Planning and Research, clarifying the tasks on the three collaborative innovation research platforms of intelligent transport networks, intelligent service engine and intelligent media processing. It also has defined clear goals of the center in the sectors of research and innovation, academic development, team building, personnel training and the exchange of domestic and international cooperation. Professor Zhang Wenjun also introduced the specific work done in the Center recently in terms of the internal control system.

Academician Gao Wen introduced the trends and research focus of the industry and proposed that the work of the Center needs to be closely linked to the broadcast television industry, and put forward solutions for radio-television transmission and multimedia processing. He also pointed out that the research on media processing engines has already been under process. In the future the work in fields like television media platform, media big data platform and smart media platforms have will be deployed. In the next step, the Center will further optimize the allocation of resources, in a move to make major breakthroughs in audio and video industry by 2017.

All council members discussed and approved the development planning of the Center, and recognized the early work done by the Center. Council members all expressed the wish to further clarify the division of labor, undertake research tasks, strengthen the industry collaboration of universities and research institutions in multiple areas and technical point, and further cooperation in joint research and personnel training.

Finally, Academician Mei Hong said in his concluding remarks that Collaborative Innovation Center assumes glorious and heavy mission. Arduous efforts are needed for further exploration and results delivering. SJTU has issued many supporting policies for the center and placed great expectations on the Center. It is hoped that cooperating units can pull together to make solid progress. At the same time, he was grateful to the support from industry and trade center and hope that the establishing of

 

Translated by Zong Xufan   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: 2015 Shanghai Summit of Hospital Development: SJTU Gongji-Antai Institute of TQM Established
item.description:
On January 17, Shanghai General Hospital, affiliated hospital to SJTU, together with Shanghai Hospital Association, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, Australia, and Shanghai Institute of Medical Quality (SIMQ), co-organized 2015 Shanghai Summit of Hospital Development. During the summit, Shanghai General Hospital announced the nameplate-hanging of SIMQ and the establishment of SJTU Gongji-Antai Institute of Total Quality Management (TQM), co-established by Antai College of Economics and Management, SJTU. The summit, under the theme of "Hospital TQM & Patient Safety", invited some well-renowned experts and scholars in hospital management from the USA and Australia.

Zhang Zongjiu, director of Hospital Management Bureau, National Health and Family Planning Commission, Zhang Xiong, deputy director of Shanghai Health and Family Planning Commission, Guo Yongjin, deputy director of Shanghai Shenkang Hospital Development Center, Chen Zhirong, head of Shanghai Hospital Association, attended the summit. Feng Yun, CPC secretary of Shanghai General Hospital, presided at the meeting. Wang Xingpeng, president of the hospital addressed the summit and made a keynote speech.

Zhang Junhua, deputy director of Talent Exchange Service Center, National Health and Family Planning Commission, Prof. Gareth Goodier, CEO of the Royal Melbourne Hospital, Prof. Lisa Mckenzie, director of the HR department, RMH, Prof. Timothy Morgenthale,  director of the patient safety department, Mayo Clinic, USA, Prof. Wan Guohua, Antai College, SJTU, and Sue Mattew, CEO of the Royal Women's Hospital, Australia, all gave their speeches at the summit.

It is said that the TQM institute will conduct the theoretical research on the quality management and operation of the large-scale public hospital in Shanghai, with the help of the hospitals, Antai College, and the resources of international management. It will provide new platform and opportunities for hospital management by connecting large-scale hospitals with college of management, and oversees management experts.

 

Translated by Li Jing    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Shanghai Chest Hospital Won Chinese Medical Science Second Prize
item.description:
On January 18, the awards ceremony of Chinese Medical Science and Technology Award (2014), the most prestigious science and technology award in Chinese medical and health industry, was held in Taizhou. The team of Han Baohui, vice president of Shanghai Chest Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University won the second prize of the 2014 Chinese Medical Science and Technology Award with the "clinical study of individualized treatment of advanced non-small cell lung cancer." Chen Zhu, Chairman of Chinese Medical Association, vice chairman of the National People's Congress and Sang Guowei, president of China Pharmaceutical Association, former vice chairman of the National People's Congress, attended the ceremony.

The team of Han Baohui, vice president of Shanghai Chest Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University has organized series of International Respiratory Endoscopy General Assembly as well as conference on new technology for treating lung cancer since 2011. In recent years, a total of 21 papers have been published in SCI with IF cumulative score up to 149.095 points. More than 110 papers have been published in the Chinese core journals. The team edited one book on lung cancer targeted therapy. The team consists of 6 PhD students, 15 graduate students and is engaged in initial establishment of lung cancer translational research team. So far, summary of two studies were read on International Conference with E-poster exchanges and  many speeches were given at national conferences with several awards.

 

 

Translated by Xu Lilong   Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: [SJTU Wisdom] SJTU Liao Shijun Research Team Proved Existence of Resonant Waves
item.description:
Wave resonance is a kind of interesting physical phenomenon, and has important theoretical significance in the wave and marine engineering fields. American scientist Phillips put forward the conditions of wave resonance in 1960. In 1962, Professor Benney of MIT found that amplitudes reveal themselves in periods, and the waves change periodically according to time. For half a century, scientists from the field of hydrodynamics are trying hard to find "resonant waves in steady state" which do not change with time, but they all failed.

In recent years, SJTU research team of Liao Shijun applied the Homotopy Analysis Method (HAM) to first acquire theoretically the resonant waves in steady state in unlimited and valid depth of water. And published two relative articles in the top journal named Journal of Fluid Mechanics (JFM), which first proved the existence of resonant waves in steady state. Besides, in 2014 the team of Liao Shijun used the world fisrt-class storm water pool in "national key laboratory of marine engineering" on Minghang Campus to fisrt proved the existence of resonant waves in steady state by experiments. The relative findings were published in Journal of Fluid Mechanics (JFM) recently. The theory and experiments enriched the theory of resonant wave.

It is reported that Homotopy Analysis Method (HAM) is a mathematical method to resolve strong nonlinear questions and was put forward by Liao Shijun in 1992. The findings of resonant waves in steady state again proved the originality and potential of Homotopy Analysis Method.

For detailed articles: http://dx.doi.org/10.1017/jfm.2014.658

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan       Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: [SJTU Wisdom] SJTU’s Research Results Helped in Exploration of Deep-sea Oil and Gas
item.description:
Over the past century, SJTUers have made many achievements with their knowledge and wisdom. They have created a lot of "Firsts." Therefore, News Network launched a special column called "SJTU Wisdom", focusing on the light of wisdom shown by SJTUers as well as demonstrating their significant contributions on national development and social advancement.

During the period of China's Twelfth Five Year Plan, China has spent huge sums of money to build the operational capability of "deep-sea fleet" and now this fleet has already taken shape. During this forming process, the "platform security monitoring system" independently developed by SJTU has been taking good care of the offshore oil and gas platforms like "Offshore Oil 981". This system is known as the "Diagnosis Expert" of deep-sea oil and gas exploration.

 "Prevention before Remedy"

August 18th, 2014, Lingshui 17-2-1 well test was under process at China's CNOOC Deepwater flagship operating equipment "Offshore Oil 981" deepwater drilling platform. This test turned out to be a success. We obtained abundant high-quality oil and gas flow. This well is the first large high-yielding self-explored gas field in China, bringing a big surprise to a country that is in  growing demand for energy resources like China.

When all the oil companies around the world are throwing money at drills, Professor Yang Jianmin and his team from SJTU's State Key Laboratory of Ocean Engineering (SKLOE) has chosen a less fancy research subject "Protecting the Security of Platform". This choice stems from a different way of thinking - "It is better to prevent accidents from happening than remedy afterwards." The "Deep-sea Platform Security Monitoring System" developed by SKLOE is the very "preventive measure".

SKLOE started the research project of "Semi-submersible Drilling Rig Site Monitoring" for "Offshore Oil 981" in 2010.

 "Three Magical Weapons"

How does this "Deep-sea Platform Security Monitoring System" excel compared to other technologies?

First weapon is innovation integration. This system integrates big data, high-precision real-time monitoring, satellite communications, artificial intelligence, 3D simulation and other technologies, including: real-time measurement system platform motion, wind, waves, currents and other ocean dynamic environment monitoring, key structural load monitoring, remote data transmission systems, data processing and analysis systems, data viewing and scene reproducing system, safety assessment and diagnostic systems.

Second weapon is a lot of valuable first-hand information. The system has recorded reliable data of the real performance of offshore platforms in the rough sea, which can help check the platform design and reflect the reliability of various equipment, ensuring the safety of this platform while accumulating precious information and reference for the designing of platform of the next generation. It also provides real and scientific data and information for the future development of marine engineering.

The third weapon is that this system can automatically collect data for a very long time unattended.

Buoyancy Installation Application

After ten years of painstaking research, 'Deep-sea Platform Security Monitoring System' has formed a complete system including theoretical research, experimental research and practical ship applications. 

Buoyancy installation is another successful application of this monitoring system. The so-called "buoyancy installation" is the clever use of the water buoyancy to smoothly transfer the pre-assembled platform blocks that weigh several tons to the catheter holder that also are several tons heavy.

The monitoring system installed on the key parts of platform blocks can provide real-time data for the entire installation process, arming the commander with technical basis to make the right judgments and issue the right directive.

The Future of Monitoring System

Once shipwreck accident happened, sea rescue team should be fast and professional. Faced with the special circumstances of the South China Sea, it is important that we build our own core technology system, and this is exactly where SKLOE's mission lies.

To this end, the R&D work for the "upgraded" version of monitoring system "Remote Expert Consultation System" came to be included on the agenda.

Remote expert consultation system can send back the data measured on the ship to land base. The data will be preprocessed and analyzed automatically in the land base. The system then will screen and judge the preliminary analysis and issue different levels of alarm according to predefined alarm conditions, such as flashing lights, siren and so on.

At the same time, an expert committee will be established where the research areas and seniority level of those experts will be classified. Under normal circumstances, the experts of this committee will receive a monitoring and analysis report from the platform every day. After receipt of the report, experts will make comments on the health condition of the platform based on their own experience and then send the comments back to the land base. After the receipt of the expert opinion, the personnel of land base will give a comprehensive expert advice based on the comments and feed back to the platform operator. Thus, the platform staff can receive the health condition report of the platform every day, and make adjustments to the platform's operating plan accordingly.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan         Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU and Korea Institute of Industrial Technology Signed MOU
item.description:
On January 14, the signing ceremony of the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between SJTU and Korea Institute of Industrial Technology (KITECH) was held in the New Administrative Building on Minhang Campus. SJTU President Zhang Jie and KITECH YoungSoo Lee consigned the MOU. Within the next five years, the two sides would start a number of scientific and technical activities in materials science, manufacturing technology, component technology.

On the ceremony, Zhang Jie said that KITECH had made remarkable achievements in technology transfer. The MOU coincided with the comprehensive reform of SJTU, thus it would greatly promote the development of bilateral friendly cooperation and provide practical support for establishing a long-term cooperation strategy in the future.

According to the MOU, the two sides would strengthen cooperation in the development of new technologies through research projects, and hold video conference and seminars regularly, exchanging the latest academic information in related fields and exploring the academic development trend together.

The MOU was an in-depth cooperation on the basis of the Letter of Intent they signed in 2005, aiming to further promote the development of SJTU and KITECH in applied research, experimental development and innovation etc.

Presentatives were Director of China Office of KITECH Kang Dongnan, Director of Division of International Cooperation and Exchange Zhang Weimin, Dean of University of UM-SJTU JI Huang Peisen, Associate Dean for Research of UM-SJTU JI Li Xinwan.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Ling Jie           Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: 2015 Spring Concert of SJTU Symphony Orchestra Held
item.description:
On Jan 11,2015, Shanghai Jiao Tong University's 2015 New Year Concert was held on Xuhui Campus. Chairperson of the University Council Jiang Sixian, President Zhang Jie, former Chairperson of the University Council He Yousheng, Wang Zongguang, Ma Dexiu, former President Xie Shenwu, Vice President Zhu Jian, Zhang Ansheng and other former leaders, representatives of alumnus and alumna home and abroad, representatives of donors, teachers and students attended the concert to celebrate the coming new year.

Jiang Sixian and Zhang Jie expressed the warmest greetings and best wishes on behalf of the university to all the guests attended, and thanked them all for their support and contribution to the university's development. Jiang Sixian mentioned that he witnessed the reorganization of the SJTU symphony orchestra since 1985, and was very proud of the accomplishments that the orchestra attained at home and abroad. Zhang Jie recounted the story of the exchange between SJTU symphony orchestra and the top student symphony orchestra in America. SJTU symphony orchestra's performance won many praises.

This concert was performed by both SJTU symphony orchestra and the Wind Orchestra of Augustana University College. This concert had special meaning for both the two orchestra, since Wind Orchestra of Augustana University College was the 40th visiting art organization at SJTU, and SJTU symphony orchestra welcomed its 30th anniversary since reorganization.

In the end, all performers stood up, and Jiang Sixian and Zhang Jie went on the stage to expressed thanks to the two conductors. Also, they wish SJTU could welcome a more splendid year.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Xu Pan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: SJTU’s “Seahorse” Topped China’s Oceanography List
item.description:
Recently, the list of China's Top 10 Scientific and Technological Developments in 2014 has been released. "Seahorse", the remotely operated underwater vehicle (ROV) with SJTU in charge of the technical part, topped the list.

The ROV Seahorse is one of the key scientific research project achievements of the national 863 Program. Up to now, it is the very vehicle independently researched and developed by China with the largest system scale and the biggest dive depth. It passed the sea acceptance trial organized by 863 Program in 2014. The success marks that China has broken through the relevant core technology in the deep-sea ROV and possessed the capability of independent research and development. Besides Jiaolong, China's manned deep-sea research submersible, Seahorse is another landmark achievement.

The selection of China's Top 10 Scientific and Technological Developments was coorganized by Chinese Society for Oceanography, Pacific Society of China, Chinese Society for Oceanology and Limnology. With recommendation, experts' assessment, and voting by the council and standing council memebers, counterparts and experts in the relevant fields, the list was finally made.

                                                    China's Top 10 Scientific and Technological Developments in 2014

 

 

 

Translated by Li Jing    Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Professor Xu Ping was Elected Fellow of the US National Academy of Inventors
item.description:
Recently, US National Academy of Inventors (NAI）announced its new name list of academicians. Xu Ping, professor of School of Life Sciences and Biotechnology, was elected Fellow of the National Academy of Inventors.

When the list was open to the public, US National Academy of Inventors made elected notification that the outstanding innovative spirit of Professor Xu Ping has made a significant impact on the improvement of life, economic development and social peace of the people and has made a substantial contribution. "

Academician of US National Academy of Inventors is a high academic honor given to innovative inventors. So far there are 414 academicians in academy, including 21 Nobel laureates, 16 US State Technological Invention Award (US National Medal of Technology and Innovation) winners, 10 National Medal of Science (US National Medal of Science) winners, 208 other US national Academy of Sciences (American Academy of Science-NAS, Academy of Engineering- NAE, Institute of Medicine- IOM) academicians, 61 presidents of American research universities or research departments, 112 American academicians of Arts and Sciences, etc. . US National Academy of Inventors holds a total of more than 414 academicians with 14,000 patents.

 

Translated by Xu Lilong      Reviewed  by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Shi Yongyong of SJTU Won 7th “Tan Jiazhen Life Science Innovation Award”
item.description:
Recently, the 7th "Tan Jiazhen Life Science Award" ceremony was held at Harbin Medical University. Shi Yongyong, Professor of Bio-X Life Science Research Center at SJTU won the "Life Science Innovation Award". The awards, the supreme honor in Chinese Life Science, were given to twelve scientists, including two winners of "Life Science Achievement Award", one winner of "Industrialization Award" and nine winners of "Life Science Innovation Award". Rao Zihe, Member of Chinese Academy of Sciences and Director of the Awards Committee, attended the ceremony and presented the awards to the winners.

Professor Shi had been devoted himself to the research of human complex trait genetics and published more than one hundred theses on key journals like Nature Genetics and Nature Nanotechnology. He had made considerable contribution to the resolution of the genetic mechanism of mental illness, cancer, and many other complex diseases via innovative experimental techniques and analytical methods.

 "Tan Jiazhen Life Science Award" is a special award fund approved by Ministry of Science and Technology of the People's Republic of China, funded by United Gene Group, sponsored by Shanghai Fosun Pharmaceutical (Group) Co., Ltd. and hosted by Shanghai Biopharmaceutics Industry Association. The award is intended to commemorate Mr. Tan's dedication to the development of life science, promote the industrialization of life science achievements and encourage unremitting innovations in China's life science areas. 

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Multi Techniques Innovated by SJTU Helps to Make China First Jet Airliner
item.description:
On December 30th, 2014, Civil Aviation Administration of China issued ARJ21-700 aircraft certificate to Commercial Aircraft Corp. of China in Beijing, marking the first certification approval of China's regional jet aircraft by Civil Aviation Administration of China. The aircraft is designed to ensure the basic safety requirements and wins the access to participating in the civil air transportation activities, to which, a number of techniques innovated by SJTU contributes a lot.

Over the past five years, SJTU and Commercial Aircraft Corp. of China conducted in-depth cooperation and build several joint R&D platform such as an R&D center of advanced civil aircraft manufacturing technology as well as a center for civil aircraft maintenance engineering. We have co-trained many first-class aviation professionals of multi-level and various types. Besides, we have also cooperated to bring outcome on many key technologies for civil aircraft engineering.

The scientific research results by SJTU in fields of aircraft digital manufacturing and assembly, structural strength test, anti-icing and deicing as well as human factors engineering have been applied and proved to be successful in the ARJ21 aircraft design and manufacturing and airworthiness certification process. These scientific research have also led to the development of related disciplines and faculties.

This certification award of ARJ21-700 is not only a milestone in the history of Civil Aircraft, but also an achievement brought out under the SJTU's new development strategy of collaborating technology innovation with the needs of national economy.

 

 

 

 

 

Translated by Zong Xufan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu

item.title: Dai Kerong of SJTU Elected as Foreign Corresponding Member of French National Academy of Medicine
item.description:
Professor Dai Kerong, Member of Chinese Academy of Engineering, Director of Institute of Bone and Joint and Director of Shanghai Joint Surgery Medical Center, was elected as the Foreign Corresponding Member of French National Academy of Medicine.

French National Academy of Medicine, which is regarded as the supreme institution of French medical community and the authority of French medical policy research and medical literacy, was founded in 1820 and is home to many Nobel Prize winners in physiology or medicine. It holds 130 full members, 160 corresponding members, 40 foreign associate members and 100 foreign corresponding members. The academy only employs internationally renowned scholars who are widely acknowledged by their peers as its foreign corresponding members.

Professor Dai was invited to join the academy for his outstanding contribution in clinical areas like neoarthrosis, biomechanics, orthopedics and cartilage regenerative medicine, etc.

 

 

 

Translated by Zhao Bingquan      Reviewed by Wang Bingyu
